Reviews.Title: “Small but nice”
Reviews.Author: jpamacio
Reviews.Content: Our room is small but nice. I love the interior. It has 2 beds 1 double and 1 single. Worth it. Has a lot of cheap resto just outside the hotel. Our room is small but nice. I love the interior. It has 2 beds 1 double and 1 single. Worth it. Has a lot of cheap resto just outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “second stay”
Reviews.Author: terry r
Reviews.Content: although my first stay was almost 8 years ago , I returned last week on business room was clean and comfortable , evreything worked and even though I was only ther for 3 nights , I was very happy. Hotel has good selection of in house restaurants (avanti pizza was excellent) . Location is a little remote from "downtown" Kowloon , but hotel has free shuttle bus to nearest rail station and free shuttle to airport . Good shopping mall on 5 minutes away by taxi . The quality of the hotel is not reflected in room rates . only 2 min walk from local shops and restaurants where local food is served . highly recommended !!!

Reviews.Title: “A GOOD HOTEL CHOICE”
Reviews.Author: resortmanSingapore
Reviews.Content: Decided to give this hotel a try regardless of other reviews by Tripadvisor forum contributors. Landed at HKIA and went to this hotels counter at the airport. It would cost us HKG$200+ per person to arrange Hotel transfer to the Hotel in Shatin. Very helpful Regal staff directed us to take the A41 express bus which costs HKG$22.90 each (or so) Bus stopped near a subway and the hotel was just in front of the other side of the subway.Tell the bus driver and he will alert you as to where to get off. Check in was efficient and took less than 20 minutes. Room was nice and clean and all modcons worked.Just be aware that if you do your internet in the room..you will be charged. Free wifi is only in the lobby or the poolside. Had Tim Sum lunch in the hotel's restraunt. Good. A bit pricey.Check your bills before you pay. Had two additional items in ours which we did not order or ate.Amicably settled with Captain. Place was full, maybe thats why the confusion?Next table had about the same problem. Management should look into this. Buffet breakfast was reasonably good if you do not have to eat it 5 times over.Menu should be rotated. Management should look into this also. Acessibility to ALL over Hong Kong and Kowloon places very convenient by Bus or MTR. Hotel provides a shuttle every 30 minutes to Shatin Station.Lots of buses from just out side hotel to Shatin Station.Good to take a stroll along the river thats just in front of the hotel. Staff in all departments we encountered were service oriented and pleasant and informative.Check out took a little longer, about 40 minutes.A bit too long.They have a holding adjacent room for Groups but the floor staff did not attempt to"herd the sheep" The check out area was swamped by the groups cheking in and checking out. Maybe Management may consider using the 15th floor Regal Club for FITs to check in and out during peaks? A good value for money hotel indeed.

Reviews.Title: “The last hotel I would stay in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Marketing87802000
Reviews.Content: The airport desk of hotel try to surcharge me 3rd person for airport pick up while the reservation dept. already arrange complimentary shuttle for 3 of us, by the time I checked in, the front desk chewed gum and no smile or greeting to guests, the concierge kept me waiting for over 10 minutes and did service to other guests by the time she promised to check the restaurant for Yam-Cha, the free wifi or internet only in Lobby, the poker faces of most of Front Officers in hotel stop me to stay afterward.

Reviews.Title: “Referred by friend!!”
Reviews.Author: Honey425
Reviews.Content: I had a friend who stayed at this hotel a few months back and she said it was one of the better hotels in Hong Kong. She mentioned that the staff is really friendly and the rooms are super clean. On her recommendation I have booked my stay here on sep 23. I am looking forward to my stay there, hopefully it will be as great as everyone else's. She mentioned that I should ask for a room specifications before going for my stay, however unsure how to do so as I booked through Priceline.com ( tried to book through the hotel Website directly but they wouldn't accept my credit card when the same card worked on Priceline... Bit of an irritance but hoping that trip will be much better)

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: James T
Reviews.Content: The hotel was packed! Great experience, breakfast buffet is a great deal for the money. If you book online, you get free internet and free shuttle between hotel and the airport. If I can make any gripe about the hotel, the elevator is odd. We had to wait at times 20 + minutes before the elevator would arrive on our hotel then it would have to stop on EVERY floor. Sure that engineering and proper programming will fix this problem. If we weren't on the 13th floor, we would have used the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel but go for the higher floors”
Reviews.Author: 4kiwis2011
Reviews.Content: We ended up here for one night because we were stuck at Hong Kong airport. They gave us two rooms on one of the higher floors and those rooms are really great. Fantastic view, great bathroom and comfy beds. We really rested and enjoyed a very good breakfast the next morning before resuming our travels. Even though we were only there for one night, we appreciated the staff helping us out in the middle of the night, arriving very tired and with two children. We were happy that we had chosen to continue our journey only in the afternoon so that we could sleep in and enjoy the breakfast. Would recommend this hotel to business travelers and families alike.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: goldenticket_travels
Reviews.Content: Amazing place to stay.... helpful staff and nice service...The restaurant of the hotel is beautiful and the waiters are very friendly..i really enjoyed my breakfast as it is the most crucial thing to rate the hotel's food... the only problem is its very far from the airport...but the location is good..

Reviews.Title: “'Far from the best'”
Reviews.Author: Sue T
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 nights here, 1st mistake. Not that you should have to, but ask to be shown to your room, as it is very confusing & you could find yourself looking for an hour. Our first room was river front with lovely views, but as this was not a smoking room (Like we booked) we were moved the next day, the new room although no river view was bigger & still had good views. Breakfast had a good variety of food, BUT all the hot food was not kept hot & was cold. Location is a bit far out from Hong Kong Central, but public transport is easy to use & the bus stop is just outside the hotel...The hotel has shuttle buses, but only 1 of them is free, the other (Kowloon Shuttle) is not but the hotel doesn't tell you, also check weather as no buses run if Typhoon warning gets to Catergory 8, which the hotel also neglets to tell you, so you could find yourself stranded & having to pay for a Taxi + danger money. This happen to us, but after some strong conversation with Management they reimburssed our Taxi fare. All in all this hotel looks nice but really has nothing going for it...

Reviews.Title: “Depends which room you get”
Reviews.Author: Birdie56
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Regal Riverside with my dragon boat team when in Hong Kong for the 2012 Club Crew World Championships. There were 27 in my group, plus we heard feedback from other teams. The quality of the rooms varied greatly, even on the same floor. Some had very modern and well-appointed rooms while others had ageing rooms that were badly in need of refurbishment. On the 15th floor, the rooms were were very bright and comfortable but quite narrow. They had mirrors everywhere, including on the ceiling, possibly to help them look bigger. Rooms on floors below 15 were bigger but were not as modern. Some of the rooms on the 9th floor seemed to be in bad shape - some were even smelly. In the worst cases, my team mates requested (and received) a room change. On the other hand, one of the best rooms was 901 which is a corner room with views over the river and the hills. There was a lot of inconsistency between rooms in what was provided and whether electrical fixtures worked. However the staff were very friendly and acted quickly when issues were pointed out. I should add that the room rate we received was good value and the breakfast buffet had a good selection of Asian and western food. The location at Shatin was great. It was close to two MRT stations and a bus to Nathan Rd stopped right outside the hotel. It was an easy walk to the Shatin shopping malls and the hotel provided a free shuttle bus to the Shatin Centre and MTR station. There were numerous local restaurants behind the hotel and many more in the Shatin Centre - or you could eat in one of several restaurants in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Haze95
Reviews.Content: My daughter stayed at this hotel as part of a sporting tour and when we visited her 2 days into her stay we found the toilet shared by 4 girls had never flushed, the girls had to travel down to the lobby to use the bathroom. We complained to the desk staff and the toilet was cleaned but not repaired and during there 7 day stay was NEVER repaired. We later found all the girls rooms were the same. We moved her into our hotel the outstanding YMCA. The management may well make excuses regarding this but as they told us we will fix it but it seemed they never will.

Reviews.Title: “Away from City. Ok place”
Reviews.Author: sand1977
Reviews.Content: I do not have any complains about the hotel and its facilities. The rooms are big the food is big they also have free shuttle bus to main downtown and even the Metro/Subway is near by. There is a wonderful river in front and a very nice food street behind the hotel. But it is too far from the down town. Only reason I stayed here to save some money as other hotels were very expensive.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: City of San Fernando, Pampanga, Philippines
Reviews.Title: “Highly-recommended”
Reviews.Author: Nina T
Reviews.Content: Great location, right in the middle of a self-contained area. Everything was within easy reach - restaurants, shops, jogging path, MTR station, etc.). We had an excellent view of the Shing Mun River. Restaurants (Chinese, Japanese, Thai) offering yummy fare at reasonable price were a few steps away from the hotel. We did not have time to enjoy the complimentary breakfasts because we had to leave early each day of our stay - an hour or two before the Moon River restaurant opened. Our room was clean and well-appointed, as accurately described and shown in the hotel's website. Hotel staff was courteous and well-mannered. The hotel offered complimentary shuttle service to various points (e.g. airport, Kowloon area, Disneyland). We initially had a problem with the toilet bowl but it was fixed immediately after we reported it. It was our first time to visit Hongkong but it felt like home to us. Highly-recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Close to the border and Shenzhen. Lots of cultural things to do in shatin. They ptovide free shuttle to airport, disneyland, sha”
Reviews.Author: VillaBianco
Reviews.Content: I stay with my company on a regular basis. I don't pay so don't actually know the room rates but what I would like to comment on us how great the staff are. The shuttle is great as well. The rooms overlooking the river are "out there" tiled floors, modern but kinda soulless I prefer the carpeted rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: HarshShukla
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Hong Kong with my family in May-12. The hotel is value for money. It is situated in a good place from where you can get any vehicle to go to the City. The rooms are just good and the service is also ok. The only problem you will face is the language. The just dont understand our accents so dont be surprice if the caretaker comes with a blanket instead of the soap. Do enjoy the spa after travelling the whole day, it is the best place to visit. The Spa is relatively cheaper than other outside outlets. American Breakfast is also good.

Reviews.Title: “Unsatisfactory room service and facilities, average stay”
Reviews.Author: Paul F
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the hotel for two weeks and was disappointed by their housekeeping service. Response to our requests took much longer than we expected. One night when our kid was in the shower, he realised there was no shampoo in the bathroom. Apparently it had been missed out. We called housekeeping to request the shampoo. They said they would bring it over. We thought the housekeeper was on their way so asked our kid to wait for a while in the shower but it was after half an hour when the housekeeper finally arrived with the shampoo. We had already asked our kid to forget about the shampoo so he resorted to using the bath gel to wash his hair instead. Another instance of poor housekeeping was when they forgot refilling the minibar with drinks, we called, but we had to wait for one hour. We only had the drinks brought to our room after making a second call. That was again far from satisfactory. A few other times we also had to call housekeeping to request for items they had forgotten to provide us when making our room. Despite the above disappointments, we would say the staff were courteous and respectful in general. On the other hand, the hotel provides convenient shuttle bus service to the town centre, airport and other places. The only thing I have to complain about the shuttle bus service is that the airport bus advertised a 'Free WiFi' on-board the bus. There was none. The new iClub room we stayed in had a nice modern design but was a bit too small for a family. There is barely enough room to walk to the other side of the room and we tripped over the bed a couple of times. The distance between the bed and the wall is only about a foot wide. The room also did not have a proper sofa and coffee table area for us to sit down and relax. There was only one small desk and one chair for three of us and that's all. The bathroom with a glass wall and a glass door looks modern but the drawback is that it does not provide enough privacy. The television was a pain. Due to the limited space, it is installed on the ceiling meaning we had to look up to watch TV. Our necks were sore after a couple of days! There were not enough power sockets in the room (only three with one already taken by the alarm clock) meaning we had to take turn to charge our electronic devices. Also, one of the power sockets in our room was dangerously loose. The WiFi service in the room was pretty good except for the fact that only one device could access it at a time making our Internet browsing quite inconvenient. The iClub buffet breakfast provides good food but is almost the same every day making it very boring as our family stayed at the hotel for two weeks. Despite the above disappointments, we would say the staff are courteous and respectful in general. On the other hand, the hotel provides convenient shuttle buses to the town centre, airport and other places. The only thing I have to complain about the shuttle buses is that the airport bus advertised a 'Free WiFi' on-board the bus. There was not any. The rooms facing the river provide spectacular and breathtaking views. The location is very convenient as it is located near restaurants, bus stops and shops. It is near walking and bike paths which can be an alternative route to the town centre apart from the shuttle bus. In conclusion, our stay at the hotel was average as it had its good and bad sides. In the future we may consider staying in another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE. WORST EXPERIENCE. STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE.”
Reviews.Author: Donna C
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel experience that I have ever had and I have stayed my fair share in hostels in third world countries, which had far better service and cleanliness than this one. Nothing compares to this horrendous experience at this supposed "4-star" hotel. If it means anything, I am writing this right now in the lobby of this hotel (still with a few days to go in this hellhole) because it is just this bad. Allow me to elaborate thoroughly: On our first day upon arriving... 1. The one thing we noticed right away was that all the sheets had this unbearable, musty smell. It was clear that the sheets on all three beds were not cleaned thoroughly but instead smelled like the odors a previous person left. 2. Halfway through a shower, one of the bathtub faucet knobs fell off, rendering it useless. 3. Halfway through watching TV, the sound automatically mutes, then unmutes a few minutes later, only to continuously repeat this pattern. 4. The air in the room would sometimes smell like urine when no one had used the bathroom. If you can believe it, THIS ALL OCCURRED WITHIN THE SPAN OF THREE HOURS. Needless to say, we requested a new room. But to no avail. In our new room... 1. The sheets continued to smell HORRIBLE. Imagine if you had to sleep in sheets that somehow made you feel like a sweaty, stinky person had just slept in those sheets. 2. The cleaning lady never cleaned the bathroom properly. There was always grimy dirt that was visible behind the toilet and hair on the floor. 3. We came back one day and noticed that we did not get shampoo, so we called reception to request some. A housekeeping lady came knocking and told us, word-for-word, "Sorry, we ran out of shampoo. So, please just use water to wash your hair." There was nothing else. No effort, no mention of when there might be shampoo or offering to get it some other way. With regards to other things... 1. They charge a ridiculous amount and have needlessly complicated system for wifi in the rooms. 2. Sitting in the lobby using their free wifi, I have seen two people yelling at the employees because of inefficient service, with one taking his entire family and leaving the hotel. There was absolutely no effort on the staff's part to reimburse, apologize, or try to stop this man from leaving. From a "4-star" hotel, this is just bad service. 3. There are people crowding the lobby at all times of the day. Which isn't so annoying, until you've spent a night sleeping in stinky sheets with faucet knobs falling, crappy service from staff, and realized that you paid way too much for this hotel, if you can call it a "hotel." CHOOSE ANOTHER HOTEL LIKE YOUR LIFE DEPENDS ON IT.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Locutus233
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice and the service was great. When we arrived the hotel had doorman who was waiting at the door and helped us with our bags. He asked us if we were checking in, and unloaded our bags from the cab allowing us to check in and then brought them up to our room. The check-in experience was great, no deposit required, credit cards accepted. Provided us with everything we needed. I think we ended up with an upgrade room as we were in a regal iClub room. The room looked nice from afar, however when you got up close the white leather they used for the furniture was not completely clean, probably not the best choice of colour for hotel room furniture. The AC worked too well, and had to be turned off at night, it apparently ran during the day preventing the windows from fogging up due to the climate in HK. Which meant the room was extremely cold when we came back at night. The room has a mini bar fridge this stopped worked about 2 days before we planned on leaving for home. The hotel also had a self service laundry located on the 8th floor, it requires $15 in coins per run. The machines are Japanese. You can buy soap at the corner store down the block but its expensive, like $40. In addition to run the dryer at at a lower temp I had to run two cycles to get my clothes dry. (from what I understand, in HK and Japan you can only use certain types of laundry soap, most North America soaps are probably too harsh for the water system). Like most of HK this Hotel has a salt water toilet flushing system, but with a western style toilet. The bathroom had a weird layout, no shower curtain just a piece of glass on part of the bath tub. The bathroom looked the most dated part of the room. This could just be because of the materials chosen. The bathroom completely fogs up including the mirror when you take a warm shower. There isn't too many places to hang things in the bathroom. We used the pool a few times in the hotel and had trouble finding a place to hang all our swimming gear to give them a chance to dry other than above the toilet on the towel rack. The humidity in HK is very high so drying things takes a long time. This hotel also has lots of tour groups mostly from mainland china. They seam to be contained to the lower floors, but tended to hang around the lobby in the morning and evening and clog up the elevators at times. They also hog the 2 computers with Internet access. Speaking of Internet, you cannot sign into the wifi in the lobby after 9pm for some weird reason. We were not able to use the wifi in the rooms, i think you need to be a regal rewards customer for that. Because of the tour groups there often isn't a place to sit in the lobby to surf the internet during the evening or morning either. One odd thing I noticed was the fire doors are made of wood in this hotel and I was walking between different areas on our floor and someone was eating or had Durian fruit in their room on the same floor we were staying on, the doors kept the smell contained, but the smell carried in this containment area and was not exactly pleasant when passing through this area. The hotel has a pool which is not heated but it was quite pleasant to take a dip in the cold water in the pool when it was extremely hot outside. My son spent hours in the pool. One of our visits to the swimming pool was a little entertaining, we watch both life guards have to jump into the pool to rescue 2 different Chinese tourist who tried to swim in this pool, but couldn't. The pool is only a maximum of 1.85M's deep. I suspect they were just doing it to make the life guards work for their money. I found it more funny then anything else. But the pool was fun. There is a shuttle service between the hotel and the Sha Tin MTR station, it usually runs every 20 minutes, its a first come first serve, i have seen it leave with people left behind a few times. Taking a cab from the MTR to the hotel is only $20 and less than 5 minutes.We have used this when we were tool lazy to wait for the next shuttle. Its about 20 minutes walk between the hotel and the 2 close MTR stations. The hotel is located about 1/2 way between two MTR stations.

Reviews.Title: “Well-appointed Room”
Reviews.Author: travelbuddyfun
Reviews.Content: Stay in this hotel for the first time for 7 nights. It is a spacious room with 2 beds and a sofa bed for our family 3 facing the garden side with schools and apartment blocks view. I believe we were upgraded. Room is clean but the drawers inside the closet are a bit small to put our clothing in for an extended stay. The down side of the hotel is its indifferent noisy tour groups from mainland China and $6 charge for each local call.The lobby is unbearably crowded and people are screaming to each other. On the non-smoking floors, smoking smell was there in some wings where the Chinese tour group was placed. We are fortunately located on the quiet side of the floor. Overall, our stay was very pleasant. There are many bus routes, eateries and laundromat close by. Will definitely stay there again,

Reviews.Title: “My permanent address in Hong Kong – Wonderful Place to Stay !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rulem
Reviews.Content: Initially I booked a different hotel that offers Bed & Bath at a very low cost– just what I need as we will be out the whole day, then I realized that after a tiring day it would be better if we can rest in comfortable place – with hotel amenities, after all I am with my family(2 adults, 3kids). I booked this hotel because they offer family rooms and the rate is OK with all the amenities I need and space is bigger than most of the other hotels. I know that in-room wifi is not included in my rate so didn’t bother to ask for that, and that’s not one of the priorities at that time also if ever you would need one there’s free access at the lobby area – which I used on my last day just to communicate to the person who will pick us up from the airport. I would say that the reviewers from this site and other hotel booking site has taught me a lot – prepared me on what to expect from this hotel. Example as are as follows: 1. Mouthwash – It was perfectly labeled that it cost HK$20 not misleading at all even if it is placed together with the toiletries provided by the hotel. If you think this is expensive there are 7-Eleven and other stores just around the corner. 2. Room Scent – I requested for a non-smoking room beforehand and made sure this is available as I am very particular to it. The room assigned to us was very nice including the view. I think this is one of the newly renovated rooms on the 10th floor. I have booked different hotels in HK before and even in their non-smoking floor it smells like cigarette smoke. This one has a very clean scent. 3. Location – I think the location was great, we we’re in the middle of all the places we planned to visit(Airport/Disneyland/Ngong Ping/ Citygate Outlets ) will take about 30-45mins. (Ocean Park/Victoria Peak) will take about 45mins-1hr depending on the traffic. Lots of options on public transportation which is also very efficient and easy to follow. We took the hotel shuttle to Disneyland & Airport and took Bus 170 directly to Ocean Park. Took MTR to Central on our way to Peak Tram. Very accessible – make sure you research you options beforehand just like what I did. 4. Concierge – Book your Airport Shuttle with them in advance as this is a first come first served service. Shuttle to MTR is also available – but if you can’t wait for the 20mins interval you can just take the taxi for only HK$20. 5. Booking – book directly if you can – they have more freebies if you do so. Unfortunately I wasn’t able to because of the initial booking I made with Agoda on the other hotel – and used the credits to book this hotel Overall I had a really wonderful stay in this hotel – will definitely come back and stay here again, as I have said this is going to be my address in HK every time I visit. And will also recommend to friends, colleagues and family (one of my brother is now planning to go to HK and stay at this hotel). Thanks to all hotel staff who made it a very pleasant vacation for me and my family. We appreciate the welcome fruits and the complementary birthday cake for my son. Thanks to to Tony Chan, Queenie for assisting us during check-in , Canattie & Edith during check-out , Doris for the tours/shuttle, Allen and Philip of concierge. To the housekeeping team for a quick response on our request for extra towels. And of course to Josef Halbherr – Thank you very much! More power to all, Keep up the good job!!!

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Stay :)”
Reviews.Author: jeannybaby
Reviews.Content: My stay at Regal Riverside Hotel is really nice, I stayed there from May 16-19. I read most of the reviews before staying at this hotel so I knew what to expect about certain things such as to watch out for the noise, etc. But surprisingly it wasn't so bad! The repairs were done at reasonable hours, I wasn't woken up by noise at all. And anyway we leave the hotel and go out around Hongkong and by the time we come back there aren't any disturbances. Hotel Transpo / Wifi - There's a hotel shuttle that picks you up from Airport to Hotel and vice versa; and a shuttle to take you to the nearest MTR, or all the way to Disneyland! So it's pretty convenient. Wifi is not free in the rooms, but there's free wifi in the lobby; just ask the concierge for a password. Location - Okay, it's not the closest to the city. But I'm more of a suburbs person so while I do like to go around the bustling city, I like to go home to quite a relaxing place, and Sha Tin is the sort of place that feels really comfortable, with a lot of open spaces and parks; it's where you can breathe. Anyway we just take the MTR; it's really convenient. We never took the taxi or city bus at all. We even went on a day trip to Macau coming from Sha Tin. Room - We got a room at the 12th floor, facing the river! The room is spacious, clean, with elegant interiors, and the bathroom is clean as well. The bed is comfortable enough. We have an amazing view, facing the river, very nice and relaxing. It's a big change from the view of narrow buildings from the city. There's a park there by the river where you can go jogging if you want. Nearest Shops - I know that there's a nearby shopping mall there but my boyfriend and I sometimes go to Home Square / Ikea to have lunch, it's just a short shuttle ride away from the hotel. There's free wifi at the ground floor of Home Square! There's cool stuff there if you're into furniture or novelty items. If we really want to go shopping for other things we just go take the MTR to go to Causeway Bay and other stations. I definitely would recommend this place to couples especially :) I would probably go back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Room in fridgid condition; construction above room very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Shop_Montana
Reviews.Content: Just checked in the hotel last nite for 5 nites so far the experience had not been present. Room temp. Thermostat was not working properly and kept at 19c although adjusted to 22 a few times. Too cold for toddler travelling with us. Cleaning staffs were a bit noisy outside the hall way. As well we can start hearing renovation noise on above floor at 10, 10:30am and it is still going as we speak. The on duty mgr agreed to switch room for us this morning so hopefully the rest of the 4 other nite experience will be better.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Rosanna90049
Reviews.Content: I like to stay in this hotel because the location is pretty good. I can go anywhere by bus or the MTR since the bus stops are located in front of the hotel. The hotel provides free transportation to the Shatin Train Station too. Overall, the employees of this hotel are very friendly. Whenever I called the housekeeping for service, he/she will show up within ten minutes. I broke my ankle at the last three days before I returned to the States in March. The manager asked the housekeeping to change the shower faucet with a handle for me so that it is convenient for me to take bath. I am touched by her kindness and consideration. I will stay in this hotel when I visit Hong Kong again next time and I will recommend this hotel to my friends too.

Reviews.Title: “just okay”
Reviews.Author: Filter188
Reviews.Content: The Regal room that we stayed in is very big however, it is very old and dated especially the bathroom. The bathroom door panel/paint is peeling off, not much of a shower curtain, the toilet flush is finicky. Slippers are provided along with two complimentary bottles of water. Beware of the mouthwash in the bathroom sitting along with other complimentary amenities (ie, toothbrush, combs, etc) there is a charge of HK 20.00 for that. The bed is very uncomfortable, mattress is old and you can feel the mattress spring on your back. Our TV was not working and we had to get them to come fix it. The only plus side is that it is quite convenient traveling to/from airport with bus A41. We exited at the side of the hotel and walk half a block up to the A41 bus stop for the airport ride. Fare is quite cheap at HK 22.30 per person paid with octopus card or exact change. Hotel also provides free shuttle bus to Sha Tin MTR station. The hotel lobby is always busy and packed with tour groups. There is free WIFI but need to wait quite long to get a hold of the concierge for the password. Overall, it is okay if you are not looking for anything fancy or close to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, lots of food around”
Reviews.Author: mtntraveler412
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this hotel, just for the location. The bed was not that good, and the room was about as nice as lower priced hotel in the US. There were many things that should have been maintained better. The shower curtain really needed replacing, and it didnt look like they had vacuumed the room very well. Some of the outlets didnt work, and they pre-set the A/C to not go below 21 degrees celsius. Will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “nice and pleasant stay :)”
Reviews.Author: NoViCeForNow
Reviews.Content: even though we just stayed for about few hours in the hotel because our schedule during whole HK tour was hectic it was nice and cool. Thanks to trip advisor, they really helped us! Our stay was beyond our expectations. Friendly staff, although they cannot communicate well in English, but it was ok, sign language helps (i think it is universal now). It is a bit off the downtown HK, but then again it is still worth the pros than the cons. Early morning, the view from the river was refreshing. just a few jog from the hotel, away from the hustle and bustle of the city. The place has nearby 7-11 and food stalls. Definitely will come back, imagine that for just a 3 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “convenient & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jennymoney
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 nights. The bus stop is nearby. we took the bus for the city tour. 7-11 and various kinds of restaurants, Japanese, Italian, Viet, Cantonese, satisfied me. I can also enjoy the beautiful view of the canal. The bed is soft and big. The room is spacious and neat. There is a hair dryer , an adapter, two more pillows and quilts in the room. We feel comfortable in it. I like the hotel. I would like to go next time.

Reviews.Title: “bad plumbing”
Reviews.Author: bonnie2603
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as little family accommodation was available when we travelled. Only stayed one night and were pretty disappointed. The room was ok in terms of size, 4 single beds as requested but all very hard. The main let down was the poor plumbing. the toilet flushing mechanism broke after only 1 use. On complaining someone was sent to fix it but no offer of a better room was made-this was 11.30 pm at night and we all desperately wanted some sleep. After a long repair job the mechanism broke again, we gave up and used the lobby facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: lalalatracy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night as Royal Park was fully booked, Regal Hotel is really old, reception/lobby area is very busy, complicated & wifi is not readily available, a password is required from the concierge, but concierge always seems busy. The room & bathroom is really big but it's so dated & old, however it is clean & comfortable. Most amenities are provided incl slippers, but there are no dressing gowns etc. Hotel is in a pretty bad location so hotel provides a free shuttle bus to the shopping mall/bus/mtr station which is handy but I didn't use. All in all, hotel is very good value for money, however if you want to stay in this area I suggest Royal Park hotel, this hotel is good for 1 night only

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: foggycity
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 3 nights. The room was large and clean. We also requested and received a room facing the canal. From our window, we admired the huge sport complex across the canal with 6 outdoor swimming pools of different sizes and tennis courts. We also enjoyed seeing the colorful lights of the billboards at night as well as the view of the hill. Not very expensive comparing to the hotels in the city of Kowloon which we did not care to stay because it is just too crowded with wall to wall of people. We enjoyed the walk along the canal under the trees across the street from the hotel and the local parks where there are groups of retirees doing their Tai Chi exercise and dancing. There was also an occasional biker on the bike lane along the canal walk. The hotel is located in a quiet residential area. There are shops and restaurants a block behind the hotel where local eat and shop. The hotel provides free shuttle bus to/from the train station/mall across the canal. Or one can take a pleasant 20 minutes walk there by crossing a bridge left of the hotel. There are many restaurants in the mall and the connected buildings. The A41 airport bus from the Hong Kong International airport deposited us right across the street of hotel. We were at one of entrances of the hotel after we walked under the tunnel (instead of crossing the street). $23 HKD was deduced from our octopus card for the hr long bus ride. Octopus card is a prepaid card which can be used for bus, train, trolley, metro rides and food as well. You can buy it at the HK airport or any 7-11 store. We would not mind to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but no free WiFi!”
Reviews.Author: Jackie C
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and adequate but a bit shabby. Curtains falling off the rails. WiFi in rooms but too expensive. I'd expect it to be free in a 4 star hotel. Only place to plug the kettle in was on the floor. Shuttle bus to centre was good and main bus route runs from right outside so very accessible. Needs refurbishment but would stay there again if I could have free WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room for our family (after we asked to change)”
Reviews.Author: Steve L
Reviews.Content: As a family we're always looking for good quadruple room options, and Regal Riverside is one of the few 4-star hotels in Hong Kong to offer them. I booked online. We weren't too impressed when we first saw our room: the quad rooms (4 single beds) turned out only to be available on the smoking floors in the old part of the hotel. There was no safe box in the room (pretty essential when travelling with family with passports, money, Ipods etc) and no minibar (I like to have a fridge to keep our own supplies cool). But to give the hotel its due, they agreed without argument to move us up to a room in the renovated non-smoking floors of the hotel, this time with two double beds, safe box and fridge. The room was clean and well laid out, with reasonable-length beds, by HK standards. So we had a great stay after that. The location of the hotel is pretty good for anyone who knows Hong Kong already, and doesn't want to spend all their time in Central district of HK Island. The A41 airport bus stops right outside the hotel, as does the 182 bus to Central (and this is a lot less hassle than going to the MTR). So does the 299 to Sai Kung, a prime area of Hong Kong countryside ideal for walking and seaside views away from the city. Just round the corner from the hotel is a stop for the 170 which will take you to Ocean Park. There are plentiful local eateries just behind the hotel, and smarter ones (and lots of shopping) at Newtown Plaza, which is 15 minutes walk across the river, or around HK$3.5 on the bus.

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms, but what a service!”
Reviews.Author: kappe63
Reviews.Content: A good location in front of the river, a very nice environment and a big room, even if the shower is placed too low for a western and it is difficult to fit under. Everything is clean and the bed comfortable. The service is terrible: I had to wait 15 minutes to get my room, even if I already paid the full amount on line, there is even a valet to keep you on line... They pick up my luggage from the taxi, without giving me a receipt, so after I had to call first, than to go to the concierge to look for my luggage, that it seemed to be lost. They found it only one hour later, even complaining because I was talking to them too Loudly, making the other guest understanding that they lost my luggage. None did speed up to search for my luggage, I lost the beginning of the meeting I went to Hong Kong for. For that price I would aspect ed a much better service, certainly not so careless. I went there twice: the first and the last.

Reviews.Title: “one of the few hotels that offers quad rooms”
Reviews.Author: orson_y
Reviews.Content: This is a long overdue review. Stayed July 2011 for 5 nights on a quad room. We arrived around noon, and found the room not available (official check in is around 2pm), so we went to the shopping center to have lunch. Directions were given by the helpful guys manning the concierge desk. When we finally got back to the hotel, we were efficiently given our rooms. Unforutnately i requested for double beds during reservations and even told the lady handling our checkin, but was given 4 singles on the lower floors instead. No reason given, not sure if she was not conversant in English, but she did not seem to feel like talking to me. What really surprised me was when i asked for an extra card key, she just dismissed my the request. just like my request for double beds. No reason given why i could not be given an extra room key with 4 people staying in the room. This was not a good start of our stay. when we reached the floor of our bedroom, i noticed that a wing was under renovation so it was very dusty and noisy going out from the elevator. good thing my friends and I are heavy sleepers so no worries about noise, but the dust was creeping out of the plasic curtains that they setup. so when you are waiting for the elevator you would get a sniff of the dusts. not sure if they advertise free wireless, but it did not seem to work, i had to plug the cable to get internet. the shampoo/conditioner is the dispenser type, they offer a couple of toothbush for a room meant for 4. and the small mouthwash cost 10$. toilet and bathroom are dated but reasonably clean and functional. one of the four single beds was pretty worn out - it was extra soft with no support. our rooms were not facing the river, what we see out the window was the scaffholding and the nearby school. not really a concern for us. but having booked for 5 nights, i would have thought that a better room could have been given. One of the promotion they offered was free minibar (softdrinks/water), unfortunately i think housekeeping was not aware. i called them the first night, the lady on the line just said yes but nothing happened. the second night, also the same thing. the third night, i had it and went down to reception. i got scolded by the receptionist that there was a queue of people waiting to checkin. i told her that was not there to checkin but to complain for the lack of service. it was then that she changed her tone and offered me the complaint / feedback form. i told her, i didn't need it, that i want the problem to get resolved. i suspect there's just a language problem as the housekeeping ladies seems to be pretty efficient in their jobs. Most probably, they never understood what i needed. but these things should never happen in a 4 star hotel. pool was closed during our stay, the fitness center was pretty decent. a huge choice of restaurant is available, if you're on a budget a good selection of hawker food is there at the back of the hotel. no need to speak the local dialect, just point to the food you find interesting. pizza hut just a short walk away. they seem to cater to mainland chinese tour groups, so it could be busy at times. and maybe that's where the attitude comes in. i would say this is a value for money hotel. but they really need to fix the attitude or language problem of the staff otherwise vacationing guest will just remeber the bad stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and and uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: YanFav F
Reviews.Content: Spend 2 night in this hotel, price changing everyday if not booked before. 2100 hkdollar first 1350 second day. Ask for third night 2100 hkdollars Bathroom dirty Nice vew on the river and mountains on the 11th floor. Breakfast only to 10 on Sunday. Nice buffet Third extra bed very hard and uncomfortable but free...

Reviews.Title: “Its great, don't listen to the whiners”
Reviews.Author: Kelvin S
Reviews.Content: I Stayed at the Riverside Hotel in early Feb. Although Check in took a bit long, i was served by one of the most beautiful girls on earth (perman) so i couldn't complain. I booked the most dirt cheap basic room i could find online and they upgraded me to one of their best. There was some noise as they were renovating rooms this was done between about 9-6pm which is fine cuz thats the time when you should be out and about... I dont understand and can never comprehend travellers who complain and whine about TV's in bad positions or they cant find a mall or a little noise...if you want your PERFECT little world where everything is just how you want it...dude...stay home and stop traveling. The staff were very friendly, the room was perfectly clean, there is a HUGE mall just 5 minutes across the river...how another guy on this website missed it is BEYOND me, his eyes must be painted on or something. The mall has the MTR within it...and its just a short trip into the heart of downtown HK. The Wifi was not the fastest on earth but again..if you are sitting in your hotel all day surfing the net...STAY HOME..why bother going anywhere! Its plenty good enough to check your emails and facebook and chat for 10 minutes before you head back out to see the world. ill be going back to HK later in the year and ill be staying there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Far from hongkong and no wifi”
Reviews.Author: Giuls77
Reviews.Content: The room was nice, new forniture and clean. The breakfast was ok but there were no wifi connection and to use it you have to pay 500hkd a day!

Reviews.Title: “Be careful, Room No.15001!”
Reviews.Author: addkei2009
Reviews.Content: The room NO.15001 have a nice view, but it will be water leakage on the floor of the toilet. Maintenance staff recoverd the tank every night when we stayed, but next morning again it leaking. I think it is not caused from a tank, but the piping under the floor is broken. Unless fundamentally repair, the toilet is permanently waterlogged. There is no solution otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Your experience might be based on which room you get.”
Reviews.Author: Hannah W
Reviews.Content: Was on a family trip from 26-30dec 2011. The rooms on the lower floors were rather outdated however the top few floors had already been renovated to a modern concept. At first, we had requested for a non smoking room but the only Quadruple Rooms (1 queen and 2 single) were on the lower smoking floors. Being unable to bear the stench, we requested a change and the hotel provided us another room with 2 queen beds on the 14th floor. This room was a little smaller than the one on the lower floor however its design was sleek and modern. We loved the room. The only problem was that the toilet door was broken and there was just an empty space in place of the door. To make it worse, the whole toilet was see-through glass, making it really inconvenient as i was with the family. Service provided was not bad. Nothing much displeased me and the staff around were helpful with all the directions and activities that I had enquired about. Location of the hotel is near 2 MTR stations. Sha Tin and Sha Tin Wai. However, there was only a shuttle bus to pick guests up at Sha Tin station. The shuttle was usually on time as well. The station is about a 20min ride away from Mong Kok; not far and yet not very near either. There are stalls near the hotel that opened till late and so midnight snacks and supper wasn't a problem. Had a pleasant time there but would try out another hotel the next time im there.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings, probably stay elsewhere next time I go to Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Pumbainjapan
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about my stay in this hotel. As I arrived, I was received without a smile or any interest whatsoever in whatever my needs were. The important thing for the person at the reception was to deal with me as fast as possible so that she could handle the huge amount of paperwork that she had in front of her. My idea was that the reception was understaffed. When I asked for the internet, I was given wrong instructions which I only solved after spending almost one hour in the elevator coming up and down from my room. This was solved after talking with some other member of the staff that told me a very simple set of instructions that had nothing in common with the instructions that others at the reception had given me. Of course, during this hour I was in tremendous amount of stress to check the e-mail because I needed to confirm several issues regarding scheduled business meetings. The sort of unclear and contradictory information and procedures would occur frequently. On the first day I went to have breakfast and it was free, the second day, I had to pay for it, and on the third day it became free again. The friendliness of the personnel would also vary substantially, from receptionists that would ignore you, to others that would know what they were doing, to the very nice and helpful concierge and cleaning ladies. The room was cozy, modern looking style and comfortable. It was also clean and since I was in the 14th floor, I had a nice view of the river nearby the hotel. The bed was quite comfortable as well, and I slept very well in the various nights that I spent there. The hotel has some good restaurants where one can relax on its own or have business meetings, which are not affected by the usually noisy and hectic lobby. The hotel is situated at a walking distance from the Sha-Tin MTR station (the subway station in Hong Kong), but it will take you almost one hour to get to central Hong Kong, so if you want to be close to downtown this should not be an option. Overall, it is a good option to sleepover, but honestly, I was not overly convinced about the hotel and most likely the next time I go to Hong Kong I will stay elsewhere. The location and particularly the fuzzy rules and behavior of the staff does not seem to correspond to an hotel of such category.

Reviews.Title: “Booked deluxe room, but got a dirty bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Muijui
Reviews.Content: Travel all the way from England with 2 children, would expected a clean room, but the carpet was filthy, bathroom floor had stains, and the bathtub had previous hairs in it, went down and complain and want to change room, instead I got a cleaner to rinse the hairs away with just water, and the floor I ended up clean it myself. My room didn't get mineral water everyday or slippers as my sister room did? Why is it because I complained? My daughter age 10 was terrified because of the dirt that she couldnt sleep, and keep saying I want to go home, I just have to say I will have to consider if I want to stay here ever again.

Reviews.Title: “"Just checking if everything's ok..."”
Reviews.Author: Lelanderer
Reviews.Content: Checking in took a very long time but it's understandable in this kind of hotel. There is virtually nothing around the hotel. I spent the most of Feb 13 looking around for cards and flowers for my wife for valentine's day and couldn't find any. Concierge counter was always empty and it took me a few days to realize it was a concierge counter (bigger sign?) Queenie at the desk was helpful and drew me train maps and mall directories but the places to get flowers and cards were too far away I couldn't be bothered. She called us everyday to make sure we were ok and thank us for choosing their hotel... Problem is that the calls were around noon, I was sleeping and had a do-not-disturb sign on the door - the housekeeping staff could've communicated with the front desk. Nice touch but slightly excessive... ;)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern and pleasant.”
Reviews.Author: BobBrighton_9
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights. Its a very large hotel, but the receptionist was friendly and helpful, and the room was a good size, and the bed comfortable with those lovely crisp sheets. Tea and coffee, complimentary bottled water, and a mini bar were there, and of course a safe. (no extra charge) The bathroom was a good size and toileteries were provided. The loo even had a blue flush. We had views over the river from the front. It was a bit of a walk to the underground station, but the hotel provided complimentary mini-buses every 20 minutes. There was also a mini bus to its sister hotels, so you could get to kowloon on that for free. We got a one day (24 hour from time of issue) travel pass on the trains which cost $55, and found that very useful. When we came back late by train, a taxi was only $22 HKdollars (about £2) on its meter to the hotel. We did not use any ot the hotels facilities so cannot comment on those. All in all a good stay and would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Regal? I don't think so!”
Reviews.Author: tracenjimmy
Reviews.Content: Why any one would stay here I do not know. I unfortunately had no choice as this is where my company has decided to keep us in Hong Kong. The rooms are old and need of renovations. The last renovations seem as though they have just given everything a paint over. The bath is dirty and mouldy and the phones are terrible, I could not have a conversation with family as there was a continuous delay. As mentioned before do not book an i-club floor room. Ugly decor , cold floors and no room. Hotel lobby staff do not have a good command of english, had to ask three people before I got an answer to my questions. Do not use the wi-fi as it constantly drops out and the connection is dial speed slow. If you are a chinese tour group from the mainland then this would be Regal indeed but for me this hotel needs some major work.

Reviews.Title: “Not for people expecting western-style hotel standards!”
Reviews.Author: Aussie-Banker
Reviews.Content: Booked by my company for a business trip. The hotel staff are not great with English, it took forever to checkin. Do not EVER try the i-Club rooms on the top floor, they are so small and with terrible cold tile floors and revolting decor.. my room was painted electric pink. No bath, mouldy shower. I asked to change, the lower floor rooms were larger, but with 1970's decor, and seemed very dirty. The area of the hotel is boring, with little except street-stall type restaurants, no coffee shop/ Starbucks etc available near the hotel. There is a large mall a bus ride from the hotel, the only sense of civilisation near the hotel. Getting into the city is either a cramped bus ride, or an ordeal with many changes on the MTR. The hotel caters mainly for mainland Chinese tour groups who are very, very loud (at all times of the day and night). The cleaning staff in the hotel are also very loud, constantly screaming at each other down the hallways and slamming doors/ banging things in the room as they clean. Room service was of a poor quality, and internet was very expensive for that level of hotel. Overall, unless you are on a group tour from Chinese mainland, I would never recommend staying at this hotel. A very low quality hotel. But if you want cheap in Hong Kong, and are willing to put up with the location and the noise... good luck to you!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Team”
Reviews.Author: Leo G
Reviews.Content: I've come across staff of all different levels of English during my 3-day-2-night stay. The housekeepers were not very capable in handling my requests due to the language barrier. They have very impressive staff at the concierge and were very helpful with the street map and bell service even their English was limited. As a workaholic, not very often do I get approached by staff without getting defensive and feel like they are wasting my time. I am especially impressed by an amiable worker who came to me to do this review, her English was very fluent and was very good at keeping the conversation going in a relaxed atmosphere, which was surprising to see in 4-star hotels. Very diversified and interesting team with lots of potential they have at Regal Riverside.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay away from the City”
Reviews.Author: Kay629
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Regal Riverside hotel for 13 nights while my husband was attending a course at the Chinese University of Hong Kong. The website does not say much about the hotel but it turned out to be an excellent find for us. The hotel is 5 mins away from the HK MTR which is the lifeline of HK and the hotel provides shuttle service every 20 mins to and from the MTR station. The hotel has a few restaurants and a fairly large newly renovated swimming pool. We were put on the 11th floor corner room and had a beautiful view of the Shatin River. The 11th Floor was newly renovated with off-white interiors and was a fairly large room with amenities such as a small fridge, tea and coffee maker, large wardrobe etc. The staff at the reception were not very helpful which is why I did not rate the hotel a perfext 10! They were rude and we had to wait for almost an hour before we were checked- in into our room. The hotel is quite crowded and the reception desk is always busy. All in all, our long stay was very good. There are a few grocery stores and a Seven-Eleven down the road for any daily requirements. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who would like to live away from the humdrum of the HK city.

Reviews.Title: “A Renovated Room in a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thevagabondo
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Hong Kong as part of a conference group. The price for our hotel per night was surprisingly cheap (for Hong Kong) so we were expecting cheap. Our renovated room was smallish but well designed. Very clean and very comfortable! The hotel has many, many rooms but the front desk are efficient and one of the 5 restaurants will suit any budget (local restaurants are good and just around the corner). An easy trip on the metro to anywhere in the city. What is not to like!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: VINCENT T
Reviews.Content: The service has improved a lot comparing to before, all staff have a very positive work attitude. For in house guests, there should be free parking for visitors instead of having to pay $50 per hour or there we'll have to park in the streets. An advantage of the Regal iClub and Regal Rewards is to be able to check in individually. I hope the best for Regal Riverside Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great view”
Reviews.Author: sushil93
Reviews.Content: lobby view is great and our period was during christmas month so decoration ith christmas tree was very scenic.rooms were scenic due to proximity of hotel with river.

Reviews.Title: “Value hotel”
Reviews.Author: James T
Reviews.Content: Good value for money. If you just need a good hotel to stay, willing to be a little out of the way then this hotel is for you. They have a shuttle service between the hotel and the MTR station however it starts and ends during peak hours. Internet fee and business center fee is expensive and feels like gouging however no pay no play keeps hotel stay more affordable. Travel agency in the lobby has great service. Highly recommend for China visa service.

Reviews.Title: “Modest Hotel but Clean and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: BrentTravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because I did not want to pay high price for Central located hotel. Overall its a nice hotel and comfortable beds. Bathroom is a little small and a rain shower (vertical shower) would have been much better than standing in the bathtub to take a shower. I tried to rent a movie but could figure out how to do that - very unclear and not much selection. But overall a good pick if not paying more than $125US per night. Can take shuttle from HK aiport for $130 HK Dollars and it takes 40 mins..it was fast with no other stops. Go to Regal Riverside desk at HK airport to get shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “A very rocky start”
Reviews.Author: Lemonp
Reviews.Content: For the past 5 years my wife and I had always stayed in Shatin every time we visited Hong Kong. We love the location since it is not too far away from all the activities and yet we get to enjoy the quiet and peaceful side of Hong Kong. At first we were very reluctant to book the regal riverside since their reviews from tripadvisor had been average and additionally we are regulars at the hotel across the river and were very pleased with their service but they did not have any rooms. At the beginning we were less than pleased with this hotel ,we had booked a room with a king size bed and a view facing the river, but when we arrived, the lady at the front desk told us they did not have any more rooms with king size bed and can only provide us with two single beds, but after searching for a few moments on her computer, she found us a room on the 15th floor. When we got to our room we noticed that our room was facing the garden and was not the river. We immediately went over to the business center and spoke with a lady over there and told her that when we booked online that we requested a room with a king size bed and a view fronting the river and what we got was a downgrade. She was very helpful and got us a room with both a king size bed and a view front the river in room 15001. The view was beautiful and we enjoyed the rest of our stay, we even book an extra night. A word to other travellers, this hotel has a lot to offer but you may have to check with the business center, such as : airport shuttles, which we took advantage of since it is free and save us close to 300 bucks HK dollars. We would consider coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor service”
Reviews.Author: rabselyong
Reviews.Content: Check in and out took so so long, very small lobby. Buffet breakfast was lousy, not much choice, service staff very rude, never seen any smile or greeting from them at all. Took Very long to refill. Full of noisy group tourist. Avoid this hotel if u wanna hv a pleasant trip.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay in HK”
Reviews.Author: volunteeringTrinidad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. Our room was incredibly small. The bed was literally attached to the wall under the window. On the plus side, we had a great view. There is a lovely promenade to walk on right across the street. You can walk along the river for miles. The buffet breakfast was good and included Western food. There is am Italian restaurant called Avanti in the lobby. The food was not great, and it is very pricey. I would never go back again. Head out the front doors and turn right and go to VI. This is a great Thai restaurant. Food and service is amazing! This restaurant is still attached to the Hotel, and you get a discount when you mention that you are staying at the Regal Riverside. The pool was closed when we stayed, so can't comment on it. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Improving service at I Club floor”
Reviews.Author: audrey-Tam
Reviews.Content: Recent stay with family at Regal Riverside Hotel -I club lounge floor at 17/F. Personally found that their service provided was improved and the room was quite this time as located at 17 th floor. The lounge located at 15th floor and it may possibly causing a bit nosiy. The variety of food provided in the lounge increased and the room was clean & tidy. Overall, the quality of service was improved than before(stayed for 4-5 time between 2009-2010) Particular the room service and the service at reception.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel room but slightly outdated”
Reviews.Author: yuchung5
Reviews.Content: Ok location, 10 min walk to shopping mall and MTR station Room, especially bathroom, is slight outdated. breakfast was average in HK hotel, but sometimes were crowded. ok location. 10 min walk to new city plaza shopping mall and MTR Sha Tin station. internet is very expensive. a night.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: SHA001P
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite huge. Lobby quite overwhelming however the have a staff member directing guests to keep flow moving. We arrived and as we had booked the iClub we were usher to the 15th floor for check in. This was very nice and it was where buffet breakfast (great waffles) was served each day, as we had very small children this was a nice quiet place for breakfast the staff there were lovely we could also access free WiFi from this location. We found our room tired and in need of a make over however was clean. We found the beds hard so not conducive to a good nights sleep, luckily we were exhausted after our busy days, We love the view of the river, quite spectacular. We didn't use the shuttle as it wasn't convenient we also found it easier to use taxi as we had our pram. New Town Plaza was in walking distance (10 min) and quite a pleasant walk if you don't mind walking. This was an enormous shopping complex with plenty of food outlets, we enjoyed window shopping here. Whilst the hotel is quite a way out it is easy to access Kowloon, Hong Kong island and other tourist attractions easily by taxi and not too expensive...easiest way to travel if you have kiddies.

Reviews.Title: “No frills for mainlanders”
Reviews.Author: Abramis
Reviews.Content: I did spend one night here. Location was convinient regarding my agenda + places where I usually stay had inflated prices due to ongoing expo. The pros - Location in Sha Tin between central HK and mainland border - Hotel is walking distance away from Sha Tin centre, MTR station and main shopping centre - They have free shuttle bus The cons - Anemic room, it was really basic - Bad layout (e.g. practically no window thanks to beds blocking me moving) - I felt the hotel room was built mainland Chinese in mind (materials, easy cleaning etc.) - TV was up in the corner (I had to kill some time in my room and got my neck tired) - They had lot of mainland Chinese tourists (noisy, lack of proper behaviour) Giving Regal Riverside 2 stars is the best I can do. No frills & no second visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice renovated rooms, super river view, excellent italian pizza but a bit pricy.”
Reviews.Author: YoteChusoipin
Reviews.Content: Went there on a trip to a friend's funeral. I booked the smoking renovated 3 persons family room and another regular superior room. The view ws magnificent. Italian restaurant was great. What we paid was a bit pricy though, probably due to high season in hong kong. I wish there were more local restaurant close by, instead we had to walk 20 minutes to near by complex to get local Cantonese food. Beware, new rooms are smaller and pricier than old rooms.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: negin k
Reviews.Content: The hotel is comfortable and clean but the room is small. It is far from the center and metro station but it has a free service every hour that takes you to the center of the city. The best way for traveling between airport and hotel is the bus NO 41 which takes you directly to the hotel and vice versa with just 23 hong kong dolar. You can take the same bus to go to big budah and the disney land although you should change the bus or take the metro. The breakfast is very good and the personnel are polite. Dont use the telephone, internet and the minibar, it is so expensive. At the reception you should pay 1000 Hong Kong Dollar, the time that I left the hotel they just turned me the 300 of it for 1 telephone call abroad, using internet for two hours and two bottle of water.

Reviews.Title: “Quad rooms - Just the basic”
Reviews.Author: ChooKF
Reviews.Content: This is one of the few hotel in Hong Kong that have Quad rooms - room that can accomodate my family of 8 with young children and old parents. The 2 Quad rooms that we were given were basic - 4 beds - exactly as shown in the hotel room picture for quad room. Unfortunately, we were allocated in a "smoking" rooms and our view were the two schools beside the hotel. The power to the TV (and the power plugs) in both rooms shorted frequently and we are unable to watch TV or charged our portable devices at times. The toilet bowl (in both rooms) choked easily and we have to control or managed our flushing... The shuttle bus to the ShaTin MTR is very convenient and can be packed at times. Don't try to take the hotel shuttle to the Airport, Disneyland and other attractions. It cheaper to go by taxi and timing is more controllable. The restaurants and the shopping around the hotel and ShaTin MTR station is good. Branded goods and cheaper stuff are all here - just have to explore which plaza is for which kind of buy in the Plazas next to Shatin MTR. You can also buy your "grocery" from the neighbourhood (and 7-11) stores around the corner of the hotel. The few attractions near the Shartin MTR station is worth a visit (10000 Buddha Monastary and Heritage Museum) If you stay in this hotel, you have to factor in the travelling time (on Taxi or MTR) to all the attractions. There is no free WiFi or Internet access - in the rooms or the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Could have spent more for better location hotel in Kowloon.”
Reviews.Author: Wong3Sun
Reviews.Content: After much time and money spent in traveling between the hotel and the places I visited in Kowloong and Hong Kong, I should have spent more to get a hotel near the central area. The location of the hotel is so inconvenience for people like me who like to go in and out few times within the same day. For people who like to have relaxation and fresh air during the stay, this hotel could be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay here again. Rude checkout staff, non-functioning heater during chilly December night.”
Reviews.Author: playblast
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel based on Tripadvisor rating. The location is far from central Hong Kong, airport. Unlike the other member's review, the hotel is far away from the MRT station. You really have to walk more than 20 minutes at Sha Tin Wai MRT station. The hotel site says 5 minutes but not true. Most of all, the check out staff didn't know how to say "thanks" after I paid my bill during check out. Front desk is total chaos in the morning. My room had non-functioning heater during unusually cold December night. They charge HK$150 for VERY slow internet connection. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Sabra B
Reviews.Content: We booked this on line through hoteltravel.com. Hotel is very clean,we were really impressed with the cleaniness. It is far from the airport costs about 200 hk dollars back and fourth. Staff is very polite, and helpful. All our needs were met. Close to the station and all buses systems. We felt pretty safe there. They offer a two for one breakfast we were glad we accepted. Excellent breakfast, you have to get there early otherwise they run out of things and don't replace it. Room size was good but beds are terriable. We first got two single bed rooms then we asked for kingsize non smoking but terriable beds. Very uncomfortable sleep.

Reviews.Title: “First 4 star hotel in residential area”
Reviews.Author: sammie_lee_kw
Reviews.Content: It is very far from shatin mrt and shatin shopping malls but there free shuttle bus. Highly recommended is to try hotel cafe's food. Huge and luxurious room. Seems this hotel is popular with china tourists

Reviews.Title: “A different perspecitve - the New Territories”
Reviews.Author: Gulf-Neil
Reviews.Content: The Regal Riverside Hotel in Shatin is one of a small group of hotels in Hong Kong. I lived near the hotel for many years & ate there regularly. I have also stayed in the hotel on several occasions. LOCATION: Hong Kong is divided into 3 areas; Hong Kong Island, Kowloon & the New Territories. Most tourists only visit Hong Kong Island &/or a small part of Kowloon. However, the New Territories is larger, quieter and greener. Shatin is the largest town in the New Territories & the hotel faces the Shing Mun river & is located in a suburban area. GETTING AROUND: The hotel has a shuttle bus to its other hotels around Hong Kong & the airport. A taxi costs about HK$15 (bus HK$4) to get to the town centre although you can walk it in 15 minutes. At Shatin town you have a wide range of parks, shopping & restaurants & the trains that will take you to the northern New Territories/ the border with mainland China (c20mins, HK$25) or south to Kowloon & Hong Kong Island (c10 - 30 mins, HK$5-25). RESTUARANTS: All the restaurants are of good quality & I think reasonably priced. My favourites are the Japanese restaurant (if you think you don’t like Japanese food, try this one, they have many dishes you just don’t see in the high street Japanese eating places). My other favourite is the bar on the ground floor. It comes alive at about 8pm but never gets crowded. If you step out of the hotel, there are small shops & eating places, a bowling alley & a ballroom dance club within a 2 minute walk. ROOMS & FACILITES; I found it true that some of the rooms need renovation but they are always clean. The front desk was happy to change my room when I had a complaint. The pool & gym are fine, not 5 star but clean & perfectly acceptable given the price.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: fedelaney
Reviews.Content: A perfectly serviceable hotel in Sha Tin very convenient if your business takes you to Fo Tan. The riverside promenade is safe and lovely for a morning run, stroll - or tai chi. An easy walk to the Sha Tin Wei station - but this is NOT in the heart of Hong Kong. Personally, I liked being in a more residential community and seeing the real hong Kong at work and play - taking their kids to the nursery school across the greenway or riding their bikes in the evening. The staff are very helpful - especially Frankie at the front desk and they will do anything for their guests. Just understand many of their guests are busloads of chinese tourists and you need to be flexible as a western visitor. I will return again in January.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: ajsiromani
Reviews.Content: A good property with spacious rooms but not well maintained. Quite far from the city. Have to take the shuttle and MTR. Trains can be quite crowded and uncomfortable at times. Staff were very unhelpful and quite rude at times.

Reviews.Title: “Good but far from central HK”
Reviews.Author: hotelhopperlee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 days with my fiance. The room is clean and cozy. We had a great view of the river across the street. The only downside is that it is far from central HK and breakfast options are limited.

Reviews.Title: “"3 star - was more like a dirty youth hostel"”
Reviews.Author: Laura C
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days out of the 10 days in HK. We booked the hotel after seeing good reviews online however, we were very disappointed. We spent the first 45 mins waiting in a queue to check in with large lugguage and no one to help. Once we got to the check in desk - I speak catonese and was thorough appalled at the staff's manner - they were NOT helpful or friendly and nothing like what I would expected of a 3 star hotel. They did not tell us about the times for breakfast or show us where we could find the gym or swimming pool. All they did was give us took our credit card details, the electronic key cards and pointed us to the lift. Once in the rooms they are a nice size, however very dated. The bathroom suite was very old and we found hairs in the plug hole and noted that the wash basis had not been cleaned. It was absolutely appalling. We complained to reception and they offered for a cleaner to come up and clean the room. That night we also went to the skybar and drinks were a rip off price - we got 4 drinks and paid over $200 hong kong dollars for them! I ordered a manhatten cocktail and it was more like drinking off whiskey and ice. My sister ordered a glass of white wine and you could tell the white wine had been corked/ open bottle which noone has drunk for ages. The staff found it difficult to understand us when we ordered in english. Breakfast the next day - offered a lot of choice however, the food was often cold and staff were really unfriendly. We also used the internet connect which they charge at a daily rate and for each IP connection. The connection was very slow and very expensive. Do not go on the internet is my advise. Also went to the swimming pool, which they do have a lifeguard however, he was very unfriendly and did not understand the concept of a locker room, until I spoke catonese. By the end of day 4 we had had enough and decided to opt for another hotel. Do not be fooled by the low prices they are not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable..... for the price!!”
Reviews.Author: Husain A
Reviews.Content: Lets start with the positives :- 1. Really huge hotel with over 1000 rooms. Rooms are spacious for Hongkong standards (atleast the one i got was big enough). 2. Good transport system of the hotel. Provide shuttle to the airport (though they charge for it), Disneyland, Downtown Kowloon & Shatin MTR station. 3. A good number of restaurants within the hotel premises offering a wide range of delicacies. 4. Staff was reasonable. Room service was fine. Drawbacks :- 1. Really far from the city (Kowloon & Hongkong island). 2. Wifi is expensive. 3. Can improve on the buffet breakfast. 4. Need to control the swimming pool temperature (i had chills down my spine due to the ice cold water).

Reviews.Title: “Recommand a good hotel in Hong Kong , Chian”
Reviews.Author: Kenneth C
Reviews.Content: Good location , easy to arrive everywhere in Hong Kong . Good communication and front desk service . Good room facilities .

Reviews.Title: “Some kind staff, most surley, poor food & service”
Reviews.Author: Anthrotravel
Reviews.Content: Do not be fooled by low pre-booking rates. They do not compensate for cold eggs, chilly breakfast meats, dirty coffee cups, and grouchy, overworked staff. Do not suppose that your pre-booked room might be changed or refunded. Do not try to share your internet connection with colleagues with whom you work (you will be cut from the Internet). Do not try to use the phone from the desk (it won't reach). Do not expect the bell staff to do anything other than pick their teeth when you arrive laden with luggage at midnight to find that your booking has vanished and all hotels are full. It is hard to find a decent hotel in Hong Kong, and the New Territories are indeed a pleasant alternative to Central or Kowloon. We can hope that smaller boutiques with better service will replace poorly managed behemoths like this.

Reviews.Title: “More relaxing than Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Frank P
Reviews.Content: The Regal Riverside looks like any other hotel - big and lots of facilities; but it has the great advantage of being situated on a river with a quite amazing park on the far bank. The hotel is about 45 minutes by bus (the very convenient, and cheap, 81C from just outside the hotel costs about 35 eurocents to get to the centre of Kowloon for the Star ferry to Hong Kong island). Restaurants in the hotel are "western", but outside we ate in (or rather, outside) chinese restaurants catering foir locals at a fraction of the price. The hotel offers all normal, Western facilities - the annoying exception, charges for WiFi internet were overcome by walking over the river to the park to use free WiFi courtesy of the HK government! This was a great place for us to stay for the three nights in Hong Kong - it also had a free shuttle bus to and from the airport, providing you weren't flying too early!

Reviews.Title: “Bad service”
Reviews.Author: GT T
