Reviews.Content: I visited the hong kong on the 24th Oct with my 2 sisters and had already pre-booked a room with 3 beds. We were only staying there for 2 nights. I decided to try this hotel as I was told that the hotel was new. When I arrived to check in I had to wait almost 30mins to check in. They did not bother to open a new desk to serve there customers. we had to pay $500 deposit and should get it back when we check out. Ok after checking in we waited to see if anyone was going to take our luggage to our rooms but in the end no one did. We later went to our rooms and already we noticed some sort of stain on the duvet. Not a good start really. As we came from the Uk we were jet lagged so at night we decided to order room service where we were told that we could pay straight away or have it taken for deposit. The room service for the first night was ok. The second night we decided to order room service again and again paid for the food straight away and even gave the guy a tip! We checked out in the morning and again we had to wait even though it was 6am. At the check out the woman was ok except we were given like $300 instead of $500. They decided to take out the money from the 2nd food room service even though I had paid for it already and gave the guy a tip. We told them we had an early flight so need to live asap. It took them a good 20 mins to find the order which my sister signed for. I told them that we had paid for it already. The manager then decided to look for the guy who gave us our food. In the end the manager did manager to find the guy and I was told that the guy does NOT RECALL us paying him. In the end we were told to leave our credit card details where they could charge us if it was found we didnt pay. I told them no and in the end after much arguing they decided to give us our $500 back. They made it seem as though we were cheap for not paying food. The money was not the problem but a matter of principle. Also to mention, the hotel was pretty far to the main shopping centre. Had to take a taxi to main MTR sha tin station which was pretty troublesome as there were not many taxis around.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad, and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: dr_iggy
Reviews.Content: The good: roomy rooms; great food in the hotel restaurants; lots of green spaces around the hotel. The bad: out in the boondocks, in what appears to be a rundown (though not unsafe) area; LOTS of tour groups, so expect to do a bit of waiting and queuing; renovations. The ugly: a definite institutional feel to an uninspiring, communist-style building; shape of building means that if you are facing the pool, you will hear it; male staff at the checkout desk extremely surly and unfriendly, leaving a poor lasting impression.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kmupadhya
Reviews.Content: Rooms are spacious, Bathrooms are good looking and well maintained, break fast is fentastic.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, inconvenient location!”
Reviews.Author: Caris25
Reviews.Content: The hotel a modern building located in Shatin on the bank of a river, has a large amount of rooms and caters mainly to Chinese Groups. I took the complimentary hotel shuttle from the airport to the hotel and vice versa. As a business traveler I did not realize until I got to the hotel as to how far it was from Central where most of my business meetings took place (two MTR train changes that took 45 minutes to one hour). The room was renovated with a comfortable mattress and linen, excellent shower pressure, blackout curtains and beautiful views over the river and the public pool on the opposite bank. A small selection of TV stations offered. Service was mediocre. Excellent value for money for a Hong Kong Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good family vacation at Regal Riverside Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andre-Antoinette
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 4-7 October 2011 at Regal Riverside Hotel and had a good family vacation. The hotel was good and we enjoyed the swimming pool and the free shuttle bus to the New Town Plaza mall. We like to thank the manager of the hotel Mr. Josef Halbherr for refering our booking to Mr Vincent Chiang who on his part went out of his way to confirm our hotel stay at the last minute - a real gem. Another thank you is to Mr James Ken who really tried his best to give us a room that satisfied us - as we were celebrating our anniversary the 3 single bed room did not please us and he really went out of his way to try and help us, as the hotel was quite full. He is a good ambassador for your hotel. If you are willing to pay a bit more I would suggest the Regal iclub rooms on the higher floors. We only had a quick look but will next time definately book them if we can get a special rate.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our short trip in Regal!”
Reviews.Author: Travelcouple201
Reviews.Content: We booked the last mintues deal in September for 2 nights. We decided to treat ourselves and booked the iClub room. We took the free shuttle from airport to hotel. As soon as we arrived the hotel and saw the queue, we thought we had made the right decision. We went up to the 15/F directly to check in. It was a nice VIP area and the girls were friendly and nice. We got a room on 11/F immediately though we arrived at 11am. The room is clean and hugh (compare to those hotels rooms in Kowloon side)! After we sorted ourselves out, we took the free shuttle to Shatin and did a bit of sightseeing. Since we have been travelling, we had an early night and we both had a very good sleep. The next morning we had breakfast in the VIP lounge. The breakfast was good and sufficient for us in the morning. Since we had a late flight home, we asked for late check out. Amazingly we were given 6pm late check out! We were so delighted as we can still go out and enjoyed Hong Kong but did not have to worry about packing our stuff in a rush! Again, we were glad that we booked the iClub room for the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Bargain price with free shuttle and internet!”
Reviews.Author: Beautytraveller2011
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel room through their official website and got a bargain price. We also got free shuttle bus and free internet which saves us a lot of money. Checked into a spacious room on 10/F overlook the mountain. Nice room! We also went to the Chinese restaurant with the $50 dollar dining coupons and had a delicious meal there. Overall all staff in Regal are friendly, especially concierge, reception and the chinese restaurant! Thanks Regal and we will definitely come back on our next visit to Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Alles_19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Regal Riverside Hotel from 22 September 2011 to 25 September 2011. As I booked online, I was entitled to the free airport transfer from the airport to the hotel directly. Our flight got delayed and I missed the bus which I initially booked, which is at 10.50am. I went over to the hotel counter and was informed that I can take the next shuttle bus which is at 12.20pm. We didn't know where the shuttle bus is actually waiting at, almost missed the bus because we couldn't find it till we asked a staff at the Regal Airport Hotel and he told us that it is at the hotel lobby. Our trip to the hotel from the airport took about 30-40mins. First impression of the hotel was good as the lobby is quite spacious looking. At the front desk counter upon my check in, I was informed by Sylvia that the room which I booked is not available. (When i paid for my rooms online through the hotel reservations, I requested for a king size bed and a non-smoking room with early check in) Sylvia told me that all the rooms are fully booked and there are only twin size bed rooms available or if we want a king size bed, we are supposed to downgrade to a room that is very much smaller than the room I initially booked. After I insist that I do not want to downgrade to a smaller room, she then mentioned that there is another room with a king size bed and another single bed in the room as well, but the room is smaller than what I booked as well. I then told Sylvia that I requested and paid for this particular bedroom very much in advance and I shouldn't be facing this problem at all during my check-in and it is ridiculous for me to be downgraded. She then went to ask for help from another staff, Debbie. She then look through their system and told us that if we want our room, we have to wait for 40mins as the guests have just checked-out. I told her that this is not acceptable as well as I first of all requested for early check-in, If i got on to the 10.50am shuttle bus and arrived much earlier at the hotel, am I supposed to wait for hours for my room? I then requested to speak to their manager and the manager didn't apologize to their mistake and just told us to wait for 30-40mins for our room and he offered to let us wait at their i-club lounge. We went up to the lounge and he told us to help ourselves with drinks but we sat there for 30mins and none of the staffs came and asked what do we want to drink. Oh and not to forget, the guest that was queuing behind us during check-in, I overheard that his room was not available as well. Finally, we got our key card and went to our room. We got upgraded to the Regal I-Club room, the room is spacious and beautiful. The bed is big and comfortable. Our luggage took 1 hour to be delivered to our room. I had to call the front desk to ask where is my luggage and the concierge was rude as well. All these encounters leave me with a bad impression about this hotel. I believe that first impression really counts and I will not come back to this hotel ever again. That aside, the shuttle bus to the nearest MTR station (Shatin) comes every 20mins and there are public buses around the hotel to go to various parts of the city. There are also cha chan teng around and supermarket too. The hotel 24 hour restaurant, moon river, is affordable and serve decent food. Room service is efficient but there are no smiles from the staff. During my last night, I went to the front desk to ask about buses to go to the ferry terminal, I stood there for 10mins, shouted out a few excuse me to the staffs at the front desk and concierge, all of them just continue doing their own things and never bothered about us. One of the names we noticed is Kenneth. It was only until Debbie walked past us and asked how can she help us. I really don't understand where is the service of this hotel? There are so many hotels in Hong Kong and there are so many other hotels which may be better at the price which we are paying. So, I guess Regal Riverside Hotel, you need to improve on your customer service and maybe properly maintain your reservations system.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel, big room, attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: MrsP0508
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to HK on a few occasions, and this time round we decided to stay at the Regal Riverside for the first time. It really did not disappoint! As we only went for the cheapest room (Superior), and have seen some pictures of some really tiny rooms at the hotel, we were a little apprehensive. But when we checked in, we got a very spacious room, with a comfy queen bed overlooking the hotel pool! It was a pleasant surprise :) There was a free shuttle van from the hotel, available every 20mins, taking you to either Tsim Sha Tsui or Shatin New Town Plaza (which was great for connections to the rest of Kowloon). The hotel also offered transfers to the airport for a fee, but you're best bet is probably getting on the A41 bus; $26 HKD or so (one way), approx 45mins max journey and the bus stops only about a few seconds walk from the hotel. Staff were very polite and helpful; i.e. I was unwell halfway through our holiday and had to call an ambulance from the hotel. Staff were very helpful and even rang our room later that evening to check that we were OK. Location of hotel was very good; only a short walk away (approx 20mins) to Shatin City One, which is basically a small district with shops and restaurants, also a laundrette that charged by weight (if like us, you didn't want to pay per sock you wanted to wash at the hotel). If you didn't get the free hotel shuttle, you can easily get the 86k buses or various other choices to Shatin New Town Plaza - buses came very regularly and was literally just outside the hotel. Costs approx 50p for a journey to the Plaza. We have read that you can walk from the hotel to the Plaza, which we think is very doable, but under the blistering mid-30c heat we didn't get a chance to this time round! Down points though: costs of using wifi, pool wasn't overly clean as there were always little branches or leaves in it when we went although the poolside staff did seem to try and clean it out daily, and expensive hotel restaurants (although the food quality was really good). With local amenities so good outside, it's better to venture out and eat local.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel that needs improvement considering the rates”
Reviews.Author: oxjohnnysangelxo
Reviews.Content: Pros: Friendly and English speaking staff Easy transportation. You can take the public bus system which is right outside the hotel on the side with the Avanti Restaurant. fridge/hairdryer/toiletries complimentary bottled water every day AC worked well HUGE bed - even more than a king size Cons: Although we received some food vouchers for their restaurants it was not valid on the first evening which made no sense considering you get one for your final day (however it isn't applicable on breakfast and if check out is at Noon it wouldn't really make sense). When we asked the reception and then the manager if we could change the voucher for our final day to our first day so we can take advantage for dinner they said they could not due to the accounting dept. This just aggravated me and so we had dinner elsewhere. It's such a simple and small thing to do to welcome a guest and if it really is this case that the accounting team has more pull than a manager for something that the reception level should really be able to do then there are bigger problems. No free wifi or broadband. My husband and I are currently traveling extensively and this is the 15th hotel we've stayed at in a row - this is also the most expensive hotel (even more than London and Paris). For the amount of money we paid per night for our stay, it is an embarrassment to the hotel that there isn't complimentary internet services included in the rate. It's not even affordable and when we spoke to the manager he said that the hotel has been actively negotiating with the internet provider to offer better rates. We stayed over a weekend and checked out on a Monday - the construction on our final day was so LOUD. It felt like it was inside my head. There was no way to drown it out - you couldn't hold a conversation even while yelling. If we had stayed there during a weekday we would have had to listen to this every single day. That is COMPLETELY unacceptable. The pool was supposed to have been completed, however it was not and this was a big disappointment. The other thing to note is when you walk up the hotel you'll see "SOHO Shatin" if I remember correctly. We passed it twice not realizing that these hotels technically share the lobby and it says Regal Riverside on the other side. This was a bit annoying as it was evening and we had taken public transportation. The location is a bit far from the central area, however I found the public transit and the shuttle bus sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fantastic family HK vacation thanks to Regal Riverside.”
Reviews.Author: Vegascomber
Reviews.Content: I've booked our room directly online with Regal Riverside's website and got a great deal with their Deluxe Business Package for three days in late August. From the moment that they confirmed my reservation, communicating with the hotel was easy. Katie LUI the hotel's Guest Service Supervisor answered all my questions and requests promptly and she even adjusted the price of my package when I found out that the price dropped one week before my arrival. Our round trip airport transport were free for my family and wifi was complementary. I requested an extra bed for my child free of charge and when we arrived they upgraded us to a 2 queen size bed corner upper room with a fantastic view of the river. Too bad the airconditioning was not working properly so when they could not fix it they moved us up one floor with the same type of room but not the river view room. It was ok with us because the room was big and we loved the 42 inch lcd tv. and the mountain view. We loved the service and the pool was fantastic with two lifeguards on duty. We also like the location because there are a lot of open space around the hotel and many local restaurants. Going to Disneyland took us about one hour by MTR from the New Plaza Mall which is about 10 minutes via the hotel's shuttle bus. Oceanpark is also about one hour by bus which we got on from the bus stop down the street from the hotel. We enjoyed their buffet breakfast because it was basically complete and free for two of us. Finally on our last day we were given a late checkout because our flight was at night. Hopefully, I will get the same fantastic deal and good service from Regal Riverside when we go back to Hong Kong next time. Thank you Katie! Sincerely, Mr. Abriam

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, location is problem”
Reviews.Author: Jeganarayanan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Regal Riverside Hotel during Mar 20 to Mar 23,2011 in a Standard room. The room is really big and having all the facilities. The location is really not bad, just opposite to the river and the view is very good. We took direct bus from the airport to the hotel, advisable to buy the bus card for unlimited travel. moving after 10 pm is not good since the area is very far from the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price, depends if the location suits you”
Reviews.Author: Alekito
Reviews.Content: First the positive: Large rooms, good bathroom, good pool and quiet. Beside the river and near to most of what you want to see in Sha Tin. If that is what you want then it's ok for you. The main problem is that is it not near the metro - about a 15 min walk. Ok, that is not a huge issue. There is a shuttle bus but it's very 2 hours. Every hour would be much better. But the room rate is reasonable. I didn't have the breakfast. I stayed here and at the Hyatt in Sha Tin. The Hyatt was obviously better but it was almost twice the price. So for the money I was not unhappy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our First Visit to Sha Tin, HOng Kong”
Reviews.Author: piggylyew2
Reviews.Content: On June 12, 2011, we flew for 15hrs from Toronto to HOng Kong. We booked online 30days in advance and got a special rate of $80 per night for 5 days for 2 rooms. We had family to visit in New Territory so we chose Sha Tin which was accessible by the hotel's shuttle bus to the train station. We often went to the Sunshine Plaza ( Ma Ah San) The hotel provided us with hotel restaurant coupons which we used twice for breakfast and also a few times at the Regal Terrace Cantonese cuisine. This coupon was $50 for dinner. We tried the Peking Duck and it was quite good, the hotel restaurants are a bit pricey but with the coupons, it worked out reasonable well after a long and tiring day of shopping in NIght Market ( Temple Street), Lady Market in Mong Kok, Sai Kung Harbour etc. The hotel was always busy and abuzz with activity and tourists checking in/out. When I needed more toiletry, I asked the cleaning lady pushing the cart outside my room for more soaps and she was always willing and friendly. Good service !

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, terrible location!”
Reviews.Author: amandaclaydon
Reviews.Content: Hotel facilities and rooms are ok - nice pool and middle of the road restaurants - location is terrible. Staff are ok.

Reviews.Title: “Inconvenient location...”
Reviews.Author: W-Voyager-128
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. Hotel is dated and the interior of rooms can use some renovation. However, room we got assigned was huge and comfortable. We encountered some friendly staff as well as rude staff so it is a hit or miss. Many big tourist groups from China are staying here so it is always very busy and noisy at the lobby area. At times, also very loud in the corridors. There is some renovation work going on outside the building and we could see workers just outside our window but that did not bother us. We just closed the curtains. The down side is the location, It is far away from any tourist activity and you have to take a (shuttle) bus to get to the station. From there it is easy enough to get public transportation but the journey to go to the city would easily take 1 hour. Bear this in mind if you decide to stay here. It is a long trek everyday and very inconvenient. Food is not up to standard so better to take your meals elsewhere. Breakfast had sufficient choice but quality of food is not good. We all had minor stomach problems after eating the breakfast. All in all, an OK hotel if you are on a budget and don’t mind the inconvenience of traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, not fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: nathanl1192
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel on a number of occasions, and plan to again, however do not recommend it for the average traveller. When in Hong Kong, I need to travel daily to far North , right down to Hong Kong Island multiple times a day, so this is in a perfect location, but for those wanting to stay in the centre of everything, there are many better hotels, just a few train stops down the line. Despite this, this hotel is good value, and superb for those on a budget. It also does have a bus stop, directly outside the hotel, which can take you into Tsim Sha Tsui quickly and cheaply. Rooms are not spotless, however linen is usually fresh, and the bathroom is average. Stained carpets are in need of replacement, or just a good clean. Service is not too friendly, however is acceptable, and rooms are made up to a good standard daily. For those looking for a reasonable hotel for a good price, this is recommended, but I recommend looking for hotels around the Mong Kok area, which are also sometimes well priced, and more conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was O.K but you are Such a Long way from the City ......”
Reviews.Author: F_B_SSydney
Reviews.Content: On my first stay at the Regal Riverside hotel I must say at first sight the Hotel looks like a Bird's nest .....They are renovating the hotel and it is completely covered in bamboo and green mesh ....Not at all impressive .......The Hotel looks quite old and run down and certainly looks like it needs an Interior renovation as well ....Having previously stayed at the Regal Airport Hotel Which is in very good condition as a Comparison .................................The staff are quite friendly in the Hotel however this Hotel is a HUGE TREK from the middle of town and a MAJOR inconvenience if you are wanting to go into Town and do some shopping .....I also ordered a Pizza from Room Service and it was Stone cold ...To be fair they did send another one up but it was Very Poor by world standards in Taste and Flavor and I would not do that again .......

Reviews.Title: “Great view at a great place for a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cesar S
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel since it was one of the hotels conveniently located close to the Hong Kong Institute of Education and economical as well. The ride from the airport took about 40 minutes. The staff at the hotel smiled and greeted us upon entry and led us to the queue for the front desk. They were polite but firm when approaching customers who break in the line. English spoken by the front desk staff was sufficient to make a good transaction. The room given to us was located at the 17th floor and had 2 twin sized beds, 1 chair, 1 desk, 3-tiered drawers, side table, 1 flat screen tv, minibar with small refrigerator and a closet integrated in the wall. It was very small but the design of the room had mirrors and a big bay window that the room "seemed" spacious and bright. The tv was placed at the top corner of the room where you'd feel comfortable watching while laying on the bed or viewing it from one of the numerous mirrors. The bathroom was small but felt adequate (Asian-size). There's a shower enclosure (no bath tub) glass counters and a sink. The walls of the bathroom are made of glass to be able to see the great view from the window whether in or out of the bathroom. There are thick curtains, however, that can give you some privacy, although the only locks for the bathroom are the sliding glass door and the curtain's velcro-fastener. Best to consider the persons you'll be sharing the room with when staying in this type of room. The greatest thing about the room is the view window. We had a spectacular view of the river, the street below, part of the mountain side, the community swimming pool across the river and the floating restaurant. In the morning you wake up to the view of river where you may spot a sampan going by, row boat racers practicing, and tall buildings against a green mountain background. By nightfall, you'll see colorful lights along the riverbanks, streets and the establishments in the vicinity. Depending on your preference, you can use the screen or the heavy curtain to diffuse or totally block out the view. The hotel has a free shuttle service that can bring you to the MTR station in Sha Tin, the hospital and back at regular intervals. Just coordinate with the concierge for the schedule and bookings. Also, the hotel is located close to a bus stop. Across the street is a walking/jogging path and a separate bicycle path along the riverside that you can access by using the pedestrian underpass coming from the side entrance (near the bar). On the other side (near the cake shop) you can see small parks with lots of plants, flowers, small trees with benches or provisions to sit and rest. As you wall to the right, you'll see several restaurants selling live seafood, groceries, laundry shops, hardware stores and other establishments. Elevators were fast and quiet. Employees were very courteous and helpful. Wi-fi is available in the hotel but signal may vary depending on your location in the hotel. LAN connections are available in the rooms for a fee. On the whole I'd like to stay in this hotel again. My only concern is that it can be far from the some of the destinations tourists usually visit and may take some time and more money to reach places like Central, Causeway Bay, Tsim Sha Tsui, Admiralty, Stanley, Mong Kok, Disneyland, Tung Chung, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Average room, Good value for money....”
Reviews.Author: BelgiumSurrey
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here for the third times, I know the area very well. Especially with the eating places close to the hotel, we love it. The restaurants open till about midnight and 2 am in the morning, very needed for when you're suffering from jetlag. This time round the room facilities have been updated, so much better than previous stay. shame with the pool, as it was under renovation, so with the hot weather, I can only see the functioning public pools across the river in Shatin, which I suppose I can make use of if I was desperate.... In the day, u can stroll along the river, walk or run... very good, glad I done the walk, very relaxing. Thou, this time round, we found the hotel shuttle bus which takes u to the nearest train station, very helpful. Especially, with people like us, who uses it few times in a day, money saving hey! Will stay here again...... as it is very value for money, some nights of our stay only cost £53 a night. By the way, the bed was too too hard to sleep, so didn't sleep well at all here, the only downside.....

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel...nothing too great about it...”
Reviews.Author: bigford
Reviews.Content: Regal Riverside is one of the budget hotels, first thing you should know about this hotel is that it is very very far off from the city. Second thing that you should note about this hotel is that it is very close to Shatin MTR station and Shatin shopping district. Rooms are not that great, and give you the feeling of a remote hide out of a fugitive who is on a run; there is little or no décor in the room, bed is made up of 2 big mattresses piled on top of each other. Day one I was quiet depressed, however by day two I started liking the simplicity of the rooms. It’s a budget hotel to the “T” no second thoughts about it, each room gives a kind of sordid view of the river which is always stationary and never flows, so it wont be wrong to say that the view is of a canal with arrested water. The service is OK, I did not have any bad experience, do not have too much expectations and you would feel satisfied. The TV is also paid, so if you want to see any channels you first need to pay. They have put jammers on each floor so you cannot use the wi-fi of any operator, you need to compulsorily buy the wi-fi service from the hotel. Please note they say they have a swimming pool, but when you ask them you would be told that its under renovation for almost a year now

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, but shame about the pool”
Reviews.Author: Neil B
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the iClub, and I was glad I paid the extra. Very pleasant and helpful staff at the small and quiet reception area/lounge on the 15th floor. Breakfast was fine for me, but others may feel the choice is limited. WiFi internet access was good in the lounge area, but poor signal in my room. Free access to a PC and printer was useful as I could print my boarding pass for my return flight. Unfortunately, the pool was closed, which was a big disappointment as I love to lounge by a pool with a drink and I had also promised to teach my friend to swim. I think some compensation should have been offered.

Reviews.Title: “Happy and harmonious”
Reviews.Author: ianmorrisontowncrier
Reviews.Content: Slightly out of the way but with HK's excellent underground, it made getting to Shatin just outside of the main drag of Nathan Road. Very helpful and English speaking, the staff checked us in with lots of unextected extras. The breakfast was excellent with many different choices with world newspapers available for browsing at leisure. Very clean and well organised, the connecting shuttle bus got us to the local sites quickly without any fuss and was always there for the return trip. Externally, the hotel is being given an uplift which will make it an even better desitination which we would like to return to in the not so distant future.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money if you are not after a 4*+”
Reviews.Author: goodfoodfanOZ
Reviews.Content: This is a very big hotel with more than 1000 rooms and package tours are constantly coming and going, making this hotel a very busy place. We decided to book a regal I-club room which made our stay a whole different story. Tucked away on one of the club floor levels, our stay was relaxing and comfortable and certainly value for money. The rooms are spacious with a very good oversized king size bed. Bathroom is small and outdated and if possible avoid a room with an interconnecting door as noise from the adjacent room clearly gets through. The club level offers a reasonable continental breakfast with a number of hot dishes and the Regal house red/white wine, beer, spirits and soft drinks and some hot/cold canapes for cocktail hour. Club level also includes free airport transfers (45 min from airport to hotel), 20% discount on a number of things incl. their restaurants and a 6.00 pm (!) late check-out. The Thai/Vietnamese restaurant is quite good and reasonably priced and with your 20% discount and a 100 HK$ voucher they give you on check-in you can have a nice meal with wine and beer for approx. 25.00 A$ per person. Staff is very friendly and efficient. The hotel itself is being renovated outside at the moment (obviously this has been going on for the last 2 months and is still not finished). So be aware that there is scaffolding all around and the pool is still closed.

Reviews.Title: “My Kids Love Regal Riverside!”
Reviews.Author: ravismum
Reviews.Content: It was my first time to book a hotel accommodation online and I was pleasantly amazed at how easy the online booking at Regal Hotel website was. However, just to make sure, I emailed and telephoned the Reservations Officer to know the inclusions (free shuttle service to nearby MTR station, from/to airport) and Ms. Katie Lui was very helpful. She also informed us to proceed to Counter B02 for the free shuttle service which we did. It was a breeze getting to Regal Airport Hotel where we waited for our ride. My 4-year-old daughter was able to enjoy the Kiddie Play Area during the wait. When we got to Regal Riverside, we went straight to Check-In where our reservation document was verified. We requested for an early check-in but since the room was still being prepared (it was around 11:30am), we were told to come back after an hour. We were already given the room card key jacket plus HK$400 worth of food vouchers which we can use in any of the 10 restaurants/bars of the hotel. This was an unexpected blessing. And so off we went to Avanti and ordered Four-Cheese Pizza which we found delightful. An hour later, we got our room at the 9th floor, with 2 single beds and 1 double bed and, of course, as we requested, a stunning view of the river. It was bigger than the hotels in Kowloon where we used to stay during our previous trips to Hong Kong. The bathroom was clean and well-supplied with fresh towels and toiletries. We had complimentary bottled drinking water and coffee/tea which were replenished daily plus a working safe, too, where we tucked away our passports and jewelry. We were also very happy with the Tours Desk personnel, Doris, who gave us options and valuable information on tour packages. We didn't have to go out to get our tickets for Ocean Park and Disneyland...they were available at the Tours Desk in the hotel lobby. This was really fantastic. We even got complimentary Disneyland umbrellas which we used during a rainy morning at Disneyland. The complimentary shuttle service was very much appreciated. We tried going to Sha Tin MTR station (which was about 3 minutes from the hotel) and walked just a bit to Grand Central Plaza to visit IKEA. Our first day was very enjoyable. Going to Kowloon was never a problem because there was a complimentary shuttle service that was bound to Regal Kowloon Hotel (about 40 minutes ride). The Moon River Restaurant became our family's favorite for late-night cold drinks (my daughter fell in love with ice-cold Ribena while the boys were overjoyed with the milk tea and soya milk) and breakfast. I particularly adored the turnip cakes and wonton noodle soup, shrimp flavor. We also tried a very interesting dessert, peaches with sago and grass jelly, which was worth the wait. The only problem we had was during our third day when we were so tired and we couldn't enter the room because the card keys didn't seem to work. My husband went down 3 times to the Concierge at the ground floor to report that we couldn't open the room. First, they sent someone from Housekeeping who also failed to open the room. Then we waited for the Manager to look into the door locking system himself. My kids and I were already seating on the carpet floor with our shopping bags and all as we waited. Then they called Engineering who took out the electronic lockset and repaired it on the spot. The whole process took more than an hour. It was a bit frustrating when all we wanted to do was to have an early night in preparation for our Disneyland tour the following day. Naturally, our room was not fixed while we were out, but Housekeeping replaced our towels and gave us our daily bottled water ration. Checking out (around 6am) was uneventful. We waited for the complimentary shuttle service going to the airport which arrived on the dot. We had a grand time staying at Sha Tin and I have already started recommending Regal Riverside to my friends and coworkers who are planning to visit Hong Kong this year. We will definitely stay again in this hotel when we return for our next Hong Kong family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Texas06
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at this hotel and wished we had more time. Loved the location in Sha Tin across the river. There is a nice walkway along the river and we would have loved to walk alonng it if we had the time. Check in and out was fast and easy. We had a room on the 12th floor overlooking the river. The room was large, clean and well laid out. The bathroom was clean, a bit small but efficient. The hotel pool was closed since it is being refurbished. There are several restaurants. We ate at Avanti Pizzeria (a bit overpriced) and Moon River (a small cafe style restaurant). In the evening we enjoyed a drink at the Scene bar, sitting outside on the sofa looking at the river and street was a fun experience. From the airport you can take bus A41 which stops just across the street from the hotel. The hotel also offers a free shuttle to the Sha Tin metro station and to their other location in the Tsim Sha Tsui area which is very convenient. From there you can see the HK light show at night and enjoy the sites and shopping in the TST area. Will definitely go back to this hotel if we go to HK again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: hitendraparmar
Reviews.Content: Hotel Regal Riverside Hong Kong China It was a wonderful experience to stay in Hotel Regal Riverside at Hong Kong. We, i.e. my wife Sushila & my sons Jigar & Sagar, had stayed this hotel in Feb. 2011. We were in a group. When we reached at hotel, it was crowded because of the Chinese New Year festival. However, within 10-15 minutes we had received our room keys. We had been allotted room on 16th floor. We found the room was neat and clean. Everything like tooth brush, shampoo, toothpaste, towels, match box, shaving kits, tea & coffee maker, safe, cupboard with hangers, mineral waters bottles, Hair dryer, intercom, bathrobes, Napkins, Handkerchief, shoe cleaner, slipper, music system, T.V. etc. On ceiling there was mirror which gives a soothing & comfortable feeling. When we settled in the room after taking tea, I remembered to recharge my mobile. I found that my charger had round bar whereas the hotel room plug was square. I called the housekeeper and within few minutes an adopter was provided to us. I also made some ISD calls using the room phone. The room consist of large bath room, spacious bed comfortable for two with enough space to move around. The rate is also reasonable around 350 Hong Kong dollars. I marvelled at location of Hotel and our room in particular. It was on the road side in front of which a river was flowing. There was a five large swimming pools, 6 lanes roads. So, we have Views of River, roads, swimming pools, jogging tracks, cycle tracks, gardens (from our Balcony), and greenery every where. We used to seat in the window side at least 1 hour every day when we woke up taking stocks of all these beautiful scenes. Next day we locked the room and went for morning breakfast. While passing through the lobby we noticed a lady was replacing towels & other toiletries in other rooms. She smiled sweetly and wished good morning to us. We also reciprocated. The restaurant was on 3rd floor. We have been provided passes for breakfast. The restaurant was beautifully decorated. The food varieties were enormous. There were vegetarian and non-vegetarian items. They were nicely placed, neat, clean, appealing, and fresh. The waiter promptly and speedily picks up the used dishes so that no dirty plates remain at sight. I asked about vegetarian food dishes. She did not understand. However, she called other guy who understood my English and cared to explain and direct me to the various vegetarian dishes quite cheerfully and politely. There was a swimming pool adjacent to restaurant so we took our plates and enjoyed food seating in front of swimming pool. After breakfast, we returned to our room and noticed that the lady was attending our room. She came out and apologized saying also that the room would be ready within few minutes. When we entered the room all mess we did in hurry for breakfast was gone and the room was again nice and all the necessities were replaced and placed in proper way. Next day was Valentine day. Wow!!!, the decorations, lightening, the valentine tree etc. were fabulous. I also would like to mention largeness of Hotel. I think the hotel had more than 500 rooms, which includes budget room, suits, honeymoon suits, etc. It had also specious parking place. It is in proximity to Metro, Bus service, Market etc. We found no threat, insecurity of any kind during our stay. So, in nut cell our experience about Hotel Regal Riverside is happy because of: 1) Convenient Riverside location, peaceful and serene environment 2) Spacious room at reasonable rate. 3) Cleanness, neatness and prompt service with smile. 4) Quality of food and services are excellent. 5) Decoration done by Hotel 6) Availability of all miscellaneous services related sight seeing, money exchange, laundry, travels, ISD etc. 7) Helpful and friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Solo Adventure”
Reviews.Author: owls9383
Reviews.Content: I'd like to be honest and state that this review is actually way overdue. Date selection above stopped at July /2010. but my stay was in February 2009. It was a fact as I've written and rave about the Hong Kong Heritage Museum in Shatin in my review of october 2009. It's up to Tripadvisor if they wish to print this review.. It was my first trip to Hong Kong and I was pleasantly picked up in a 8/10-seater van prepaid on the internet. Lovely 1/2 hour drive later, arrived at hotel. Can't see main entrance from the road as it's kind=of undercroft. However foyer was spacious, bright and welcoming. Checking in was friendly and quick. My room (with a small view of the river) was very spacious, clean and luckily near the stairs (i.e. less noise). Adjoining bathroom/toilet was also clean with little amenities provided. I was told by the concierge (whom I refer to quite a bit regarding sightseeing, etc) that a part of the hotel was being upgraded. Room service and housekeeping were faultless. Tried one of their buffet style dinner and just a little disappointed . Although not in TST area, transport was easy. Little feeder buses stops regularly just round the corner from the hotel and it'll bring you to the the MTR station. This station is also in the basement of a huge shopping centre with some brand label outlets and restaurants/fast food joints (must visit the top floor for a little 'sweets outlet' which served fantastic durian mousse of some sort). The Royal Park Hotel also in the same complex. Another 20min on the MTR and you're down in TST. Alternatively, take the MTR and venture out to the little suburbs. For those not in a hurry (like me), I walked from hotel, crossed bridge, walked alongside river and enjoy the lovely outdoor setting of the park (seniors doing taichi, others exercising). Very relaxing as early February's weather was perfect and cool. To explore the countryside from a good base, I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: bhsnice
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel with my family (2 Adults & 1 Child) in a room allotted. Rooms are spacious & good for staying family of 3 in a room. We had breakfast in their coffee shop and there were no indian items served in break fast but upon asking one or 2 indian items were made available. Staff doesn't understand english and have to talk with the person from staff who knows english. Although I had little difficulty in language but still Overall Experience was good.

Reviews.Title: “Suitable for conference delegates or those on package tours”
Reviews.Author: Maysze
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the regal riverside as I was attending a conference at the prince of wales hospital and this was the conference hotel. I was upgraded to the club floor, and when I checked in I asked about having breakfast on the club floor but was told my room rate did not include breakfast . I then paid the extra amount for breakfast and was told that there was a better spread on the third floor. On my second morning, it being Sunday, I decided I did not want to face the hordes of tourists on the third floor and wanted to use my iPad, the wifi in my room being very intermittent ( another downside) so I asked the receptionist if I could have my breakfast on the club floor but was told I had to have it on the third level. After I pointed out to her I was paying more for less of a spread and that there was absolutely no one there at the moment they merely looked away ,so I took that as consent and sat down to have my meal on the club floor. Another grouse is that having paid for the use of the wifi the reception was intermittentv,and to add insult to injury, when I logged in once on my iPhone I had to pay a second charge for that

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: LadyGodiva1981
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my husband and two children. There were problems from the word go. We were given the wrong room, the replacement room was on a smoking floor, when we were finally allocated the 'correct' room, the toilet didn't flush properly, the shower had a fault with it, the deivce in the bath for bringing the plug up and down didn't work. On one particular ocassion when I was using the hair dryer, it suddenly made a loud BANG and it let off a big spark. I was so scared that I dropped the hair dryer straight away. I even had some scorch marks on the hand that I was using to hold the hair dryer with. My husband called reception to locate the manager in charge. Five minutes later and still no one showed, then he called again. Only then did the assistant manager come up with maintenance and a couple of other men. Although the assistant manager was very apologetic, all he offered was breakfast for the remainder of my stay (3 days). The hair dryer was immediately removed and a replacement was put in the bedroom. The gym is very outdated. There are lots of machines that have seen better days. Some of the cardio equipment have been spray painted to cover up the rust which has formed. The ceiling in the gym is what would be classed as a health and safety hazard in the UK. There were boards missing, water stains, pipes were exposed. The complimentary breakfast we were given was appalling. From the pancakes which were from a packet to the jaw numbing chewy and tough bacon. Do not pay extra for breakfast if you stay at this hotel. You can find cheaper, more authentic, freshly prepared food located close by. The only redeeming feature is the free shuttle bus which we took on a daily basis to get to Sha Tin MTR station. The shuttle bus from the airport is not free and we were quoted just over $200 for the four of us.

Reviews.Title: “Great business facility”
Reviews.Author: Elizabethr02
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in hotels with a business floor before but they are not always well staffed or well equipped, they do it really well here in Hong Kong and especially this hotel. No hassles with connections the business lounge is always staffed, immaculately clean with food,snacks and drinks always available. I am accompanying my partner on a business trip and not feeling so guilty about leaving the office as there is a great environment to work. Not too much though I am off to check out the spa and if it as good as the business lounge I will give it 10 out of 10! Uk hotel chains please take note!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay~”
Reviews.Author: JOSEPHINEEEE
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Regal Riverside hotel at Shatin for my 8days trip. We stayed on the 14th floor and the room was fantastic. The hotel is convenient for those who wish to visit shen zhen via MTR for a day or two. It just a few MTR stations away from Luo Wu Station. Hotel provides shuttle bus service to Shatin MTR and airport as well. Love the hotel, though is a little far from the city, but still a nice hotel facing a river. I experience a diff hk there...is a nice town~ there are a few malls and a huge ikea in Shatin. Price was reasonable for me, cost me abt SGD$100-$130 per night for 2pax. Dun mind gg back to the same hotel my next trip~~

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Angie_BLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Regal Riverside for two weeks in March, and had a very enjoyable stay. I stayed in one of the iclub rooms on the 13th floor, and was able to make use of complimentary wi-fi, which was great as I was staying on business and needed to be available by e.mail, as well as free use of the fitness centre, complimentary drinks every evening, and discounts in all of the hotel restaurants (more on them later). A complimentary shuttle trip from the airport got the visit off to a very good start, although I was less impressed by the welcome from the staff in the main reception on the ground floor. I didn't feel that they were interested in customer service at all, and while I appreciate that they were very busy when I arrived, the attitude seemed to be the same throughout my stay, whether they were busy or not. Fortunately I was directed to the 15th floor for the iclub check-in, and the staff there were lovely - very friendly and helpful. The room was very big, recently decorated in light colours, and the bed was extemely comfortable. I have only two complaints about the room: firstly the fridge didn't work, so if I had been tempted to use the mini bar, the drinks were all warm, and secondly I couldn't find a way to switch off the light in the wardrobe at night without switching the master switch by the bedroom door off, meaning that the bedside lights were inactivated, and so as a consequence I had to sleep for two weeks with the light on. Fortunately it didn't give out enough light to disturb my sleep, but it was still a bit annoying. The bathroom was adequate, could have done with some redecoration to take it up to the standard of the rest of the room. Air-conditioning worked well, I was happy with the temperature of the room. The iclub breakfast was good, although there was not much variety, which was noticeable after two weeks. As for the other restaurants, they were reasonably priced, particularly the Moon River restaurant, where you could eat dishes such as Singapore laksa with seafood for just 35HKD! I particularly enjoyed the food at Vi (a Thai/vietnamese restaurant), but the service was not that great, whereas the service was excellent in L'eau and the Avanti restaurants, but the food wasn't so good. I didn't go into the main bar, as I was travelling alone, but it was quite quiet, from what I could see, apart from on the last coupleof days when it livened up a bit. The shuttle bus to the metro wasn't a good option for me - it didn't start running until 11am on Sundays, and finished at around 7.30 every day, which is nowhere near late enough - but the walk to the metro station is only 15 minutes or so, and the route felt quite safe, even after 11pm, travelling alone. The journey to Hong Kong Island or Tsim Sha Tsui was about 40 minutes in total - living in London I can't complain about a 40 minute journey really, and it was ideal for work at the nearby hospital. The nearby shopping centre (New Town Plaza) is huge, and it is also very easy to get to the lovely fishing village of Sai Kung by bus, and out to the national parks for some lovely walks. The fitness centre was very good - could do with turning the air-con up, but other than that, the reception staff were friendly, there were 5 treadmills and most of the weights and other equipment that you could want. The jacuzzi was far too hot (I couldn't get in) but the sauna was lovely (and empty most of the time!). It was a shame that the pool is shut until April, but I can understand that it may have been a bit cold to make it worth keeping an outdoor pool open during the winter. There were a couple of occasions when the other guests were very loud (I was woken up at 4am by someone very clearly drunk and making a racket), but during the week it was always quiet. Overall I think that the hotel is definitely worth 4 stars, and was good value for money. I would probably not stay in this hotel if I was in Hong Kong purely for sight-seeing, but if they could move it closer to Kowloon I would definitely return (although the location is probably what keeps the value so good).

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: ssgill
Reviews.Content: Even if this hotel is in Shatin it is actually closer to the airport and Disneyland. Also a free shuttle service is provided to this two locations. There is also a free shuttle service to the Regal Kowloon Hotel @ TST (Tsim Sha Tsui). It cost much less to stay here rather than in the city (Kowloon or Hong Kong) yet, we did not feel we were living far away from the city. With a group of 4, we could share taxi to harbor city witin 20 min. it cost us abt 90 HKD. Divide the fare with 4 people, that 20 to 25HKD per person; abt 3.50 to 4 Singapore dollars per person. Also there a lot of neighbourhood food places around the hotel. breakfast was deliciious here. MRT ride is a little tiring as you would have to make 2 to 3 train switches. Overall good value for money. Just make sure you get the room you asked for when doing the booking. i asked for a none-smoking but got assigned to a smoking floor :(

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and met expectations”
Reviews.Author: aussiefred
Reviews.Content: We were given a room on the 17th floor (iclub floor I think). Room although not huge was very modern and with carefully placed mirrors making it seem larger. Bathroom was definitely a highlight. Very large double shower and plenty of space. Bed comfortable and TV in a great position mounted on wall. Service at the front desk efficient and friendly. Plenty of restaurants to choose from and prices are pretty much like Western hotels. The only thing you need to be aware of is that noise travels easily in the corridors and if people are arguing (had a few who did that), can hear every word until they get into their room.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service and Even Poorer Facilities”
Reviews.Author: PooPoo84
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, the counter staff STEVE was very slow and was seemingly unhappy to serve us. To make it worse, he told us that our triple room was still being prepared and asked us to wait 30 mins at the lobby. Fortunately we did not listen to him and went straight to our room and found it ready to use. There were quite a few problems with the room. For instance, the toilet bowl was weak in flushing. There were quite a few stains on the bathtub, bedsheets. And the remote control for the tv was so weak that i have to literally stand next to the tv to change the tv channels. Only positive side about this hotel is the elderly bald manager in the lobby. He helped me to call the local tour agency as the bus to the airport was late. He could remember the number by heart and helped to contact them. Also, the location is somewhat faraway from the train station. It is best to take the free shuttle bus that comes every 15-20 mins.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel”
Reviews.Author: ric78
Reviews.Content: the hotel is quite average for the standard. the bathroom looks old and needs renovation. the room is gloomy and probably needs some redesign. the room TV was placed near the window and not in the centre of the room. everything seems werid

Reviews.Title: “The breakfast is good”
Reviews.Author: Ivanng2011
Reviews.Content: the breakfast is good, the location is not next to the main station but the distance is acceptable

Reviews.Title: “Great room and views out of Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: LondonHigg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed during Chinese New Year and chose Regal mainly on price. We were happy taking MTR into town each day and liked the quietness of Sha Tin. We were given a room upgrade and enjoyed the use of the gym and room service. Decor was modern and service high quality. If you are a runner the river towpath was awash with exercising locals. Do not be put off by how far the Regal is away from town, using MTR have the traveling fun and the money saved on accommodation got spent on entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Go to Hong Kong but avoid the crowds in this good Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Mart2011
Reviews.Content: For the price concious traveller this hotel is a good bet. Very comfortable large rooms, in a quiet location. Lots of local walks nearby, without the crowds. Get to know the bus stops outside the hotel, they can whisk you into kowloon, or the island quickly and cheaply. The Moon River restaurant is another opportunity to keep it cheap, its open 24 hours a day, and offers very good value breakfasts and main meals. The only downside was the high price for internet access, hopefully they will fix this.

Reviews.Title: “Once of the worse hotel ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Alex3004
Reviews.Content: Stay in this hotel just because my company book this every time. And every time is getting worse and worse))) last time stayed in February. Starting from front desk - people are not nice at all. Even when there is nobody in the que - they ask to wait in the que even if you have crazy urgent questions (maybe im dying or need urgent help)))) It was crazy cold in the room. After asking warming system - they bring old, badly working heating machine, which sound is like airpline's engine))) There is ony 1 plug in the room for electricity - so if you have more then 1 mobile device 0 charge this before you come))) Price - supposed to be 3,5 hotel normal price) but if you take Internet (I always thought it is normal)) and breakfast - automatically it double your price) And this is not all - you can have a lot of surprises in your bill after checking out) Internet connection - IS HORRIBLE))) it was so big probem to get second connection in room. Staff spent 1,5 hours to do it. And finally 1 computer worked ok. Another - HORRIBLE) and for 1 computer you pay 180 HKD per day))))) If speaking about pluses - creative rooms, not so bad ocation if you travel often to Shenzhen, friendly staff, not bad breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel out of the center of the city”
Reviews.Author: ilias34
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is modern and excellent. 5-stars service. Take the iClub rooms, which are much better than the normal ones, and not very expensive. The doors of the toilets in the iClub rooms are quite transparent. A good stay, and the staff are extremely nice and professional. It's in Shatin, so 20 minutes far from the center of the town.

Reviews.Title: “DOCOMO INTERNET IS TOO BAD”
Reviews.Author: IsmaelM
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel for the quality of the Internet in Hong Kong. I was staying in China for the week and I was getting some speed problem at night. But this Hotel Internet is worst than any Internet you could find in your life. Even worst than my EVDO mobile phone Internet in Canada in 2004. Also, the shower water could not get out of the shower so it was filling the bath really fast. I called DOCOMO Internet to get some help, they reset the bandwith but I never got any results. I am still staying at this hotel and I may ask for refund. But I am stuck since there is no more hotel in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Helped out in a jam”
Reviews.Author: radicalseven
Reviews.Content: Some really good people here who were helpful when we hadcto stay here because my daughter came down with severe food poisoning after the flight from Sydney and is hospital nearby. Food in the restaurants is average and not welcoming to a solo westerner, but the management team couldn't have been more sympathetic

Reviews.Title: “A massive disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Ms_C24
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for the first four days of my trip to Hong Kong with my friend. I was not happy with the hotel at all and doubt I will stay here again. I booked a superior twin room but it was certainly not superior to me. I was fine with the location of the hotel, as the MTR is very convenient and cheap in Hong Kong (just get an Octopus card). Likes - Large spacious room and comfy bed - Complimentary toiletries and slippers - Large bathroom with bathtub - Free gym which was pretty well equipped - Free shuttle bus to the Shatin MTR station (New Town Shopping Plaza is attached to the station). If you do not want to wait around for the shuttle bus then you can take the bus (very frequent) or walk (around 10-15 minutes). - Nearby seafood restaurant was fantastic and cheap - Nearby small supermarket was great too Dislikes - Booked a twin room but they gave us a double bed instead. This is unacceptable as we booked months in advance. - Shuttle bus to Disneyland was not free but costs HK$ 140 (return) if I remember correctly - Our room and bathroom seemed quite dated (both rooms definitely needed refurbishing) although they were both clean. Towels were not great either, they were acceptable though. - The curtains were stained and would let in a lot of light in the morning. - The flat screen TV was slightly blurry. - Terrible service. Was kept waiting for ages for the simple requests that we made. I really did not expect this since most of the reviews here about the service are wonderful. Firstly, we waited ages for people to pick up the phone (I think they were screening our calls because we had called so many times about the heating problem before), waited almost an hour for the hotel engineer to come over to check our heater (after a 3 minute inspection he told us what we knew already, it was broken) and finally we waited around 40 minutes for the heater to be delivered. I accept that they are busy during the festive period and that our requests might take a little longer than normal to be looked into but they took ages! - The new temporary heater that they provided us with seemed really old. It would turn itself on and off, so in the end we had to switch it off as the noise was too much even though the room was really cold. - The shower was really weak. - Internet was not free. It was very expensive - Check in/ check out took a while as reception was always busy although this was acceptable as they did not keep us waiting too long. Also, my sister and brother stayed at this hotel at the same time as us (on the same floor too) but they were much luckier. They did not have any issues with the beds, heating or TV. Their room was also slightly bigger which does make a small difference in my opinion. They did not have to deal with housekeeping much (if ever) so they had no problems with their service. They said they would be more than happy to stay at this hotel again. What can I say? Maybe we were just extremely unlucky?

Reviews.Title: “Non Existent Service!”
Reviews.Author: NotHappy005
Reviews.Content: Firstly the hotel room rate was really expensive for this location. We were asked to switch rooms after the 3rd night as they could not give us a suite. I waited almost 2 hours for the other room to be ready!!! Called Reception many times but nobody wanted to help! There was a very long queue at the check out counter and other people were complaining of the long wait! I checked out and went to another hotel because of the lack of service. However, I want to say the treatments int the spa were absolutely out of this world!!!! When I tried to order Room Service on my 2nd day no one was picking up the phone!!! Waited at least an hour to order some food!

Reviews.Title: “Convenience transportation and location...nearby shopping centre...”
Reviews.Author: Fong_123
Reviews.Content: Overall, everything in this hotel are good and fantastic....especially their club lounge....peaceful environment with nice view.....nice food and nice service.....staff are very nice and provides warm smile and greeting............

Reviews.Title: “good :P”
Reviews.Author: sammy855
Reviews.Content: the rooms were spacious with comfy beds and clean bathrooms... the downside was that this hotel was really far from the city. fortunately, there were free shuttles to the nearest mtr station. we also enjoyed the local delicacy at nearby coffee shops/restaurant. the staffs were great as they were understanding enough to allow me to get refunds for the unused bus tickets to disneyland as my brother was so sick that we can't visit disneyland that day...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hote,l”
Reviews.Author: Mjgomes
Reviews.Content: Would recommend. Gfor a conference rooms good with all facilities for Indian groups hotel must provide Indian meals or allow to carry Indian chefs from India will have breakfast tomorrow and offer suggestions mention Gomes travel consultant best of luck rgdshu

Reviews.Title: “Totally fanstic”
Reviews.Author: Oceanplanet
Reviews.Content: Love everything here, staffs are nice to us. We are very surprised to stay here with many free amenities, Foe example free afternoon tea time, breakfast internet & magazine etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: YeaHohoho
Reviews.Content: Great value for money. Good choice of restaurants. Staff more than willing to help. Only negative is room walls are rather thin and so could hear neighboring rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Satiafacfory”
Reviews.Author: Irianto_gunawan
Reviews.Content: Hotel is good. Room is clean. Fos is good. Staff are firiendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: giji365
Reviews.Content: I was totally upset with the quality of room, bathroom and beds offered. The room was not well cleaned. Stains were visible on the carpet. Toilet was very small and it was tough to stand and bath in the tub with out getting my knuckles hitting the wall multiple times. They service was good, as they rushed a plumber to the room when we complained about the toilet flush not working and when we asked for an iron box. The coridoors were stinking. Only good thing about this hotel was the breakfast. Dinner was horrible!

Reviews.Title: “Manage your expectations!”
Reviews.Author: IamWhoIam_SG
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as it was close to the venue of the event I was attending and this also happened to be reasonably priced. To be very fair, I would say that you get what you pay for. While the room was in a good condition, good service was non-existent. One would have to put up with with limited & impatient front desk staff and noisy guests.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ceeejaay
Reviews.Content: We (6 of us) stayed here for 5 days for a tour .. staying in this hotel was nice and wonderful, although we check in at 2am, and the person at the front desk didnt bring us to our room, but we managed by ourselves.. the room was big, the food (breakfast) was marvelous, and we had a very good sleep.. although it was a little bit far from the central yet its easy to locate.. the personnel were accommodating, if ever i come back to HK, ill stay here again..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel clean quiet and full 24 hour service excellent value”
Reviews.Author: TravelWorkAndPlay
Reviews.Content: I stay here often when in Hong Kong, it's the most convenient if you have business / relatives in Sai Kung, easy bus ride from outside the hotel into Sai Kung centre or 20 min walk to the main railway station, the decent sized rooms are cleaned daily, with new towels daily, big screen t.v,s in all rooms, gripes...internet is quite expensive, 'complementary' does not mean free, mini bar is way too expensive, just take everything out and pop down to 7-11 (right next door to hotel) apart from that, usual freebies soap, shampoo, toothbrush...but no razor!. For those of you that like to exercise there's a great riverside patch stretching for miles and the fitness centre has all the usual facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated room with good price”
Reviews.Author: Cancyl
Reviews.Content: 10mins walking distance along the river to Shatin New Town plaza. It's actually nice to walk if not in the hot summer. Newly renovated room with modern urban look. I personally like it. We booked for twin room but we've got triple room instead. Check in was slow due to travel group was in front of us.

Reviews.Title: “My stay was enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: travelingcebuano
Reviews.Content: I enjoy booking at different hotels when I travel to HK, whether it is a business trip or a leisure trip. Of course, I try to travel with a budget, so looking for a hotel for on a smaller budget is always a challenge. I found this hotel to be worth the money spent. Though it may be extremely far from Kowloon or Central, the free shuttle service was quite efficient (just remember to bring a copy of the bus schedule). The breakfast had a good variety of choices and it was quite good. There were tons of guests, but the staff managed quite well with the huge numbers. I was very impressed with how friendly and courteous the staff were. I didn't get to enjoy the pool but it certainly looked inviting. The shopping areas and subway station were not as far, but it was a bit of a walk. There is a free shuttle to the train station, so best to ask the front desk. All in all, for the price I paid, I was satisfied with the Regal Riverside hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: AshNagpur
Reviews.Content: One of the very good hotels at Hongkong......Great house keeping staff & always pleasant... Rooms are spacious....Far away from busy city.. Charge for internet is very high

Reviews.Title: “not that bad, but very far from everything and ridiculous internet-charges”
Reviews.Author: EurasiaVoyager
Reviews.Content: due to the Rugby-7's-tournament, which was not the purpose of my stay, all hotels in HKG were full this time or charged ridiculous rates, so i decided to stay in the new territories for the first time, cause rates were still acceptable there. the hotel is easy to reach by airport bus, but be on alert where to get off, as - believe it or not - there is no sign or name of the hotel on the building on the roadside-front. i almost missed the stop. I was upgraded to newly renovated executive floor ("i-club") which was nice of course, but maybe that was due to the fact there was construction work going on on the floor above my room from early til late. maybe that was the reason why they were so "generous". those executive-floor-rooms are decorated in modern "minimalist" style, which i liked, though I still puzzle about which features makes them actually so "executive". internet is ridiculously expensive at 180 HKG$ per 24hrs for the Wifi. they have a free shuttle to their downtown property "Regal Kowloon", which i made us of. if you intend to go to mainland China (and that was what I did) after ur stay in HKG, the location might be less inconvenient, as there is a free shuttle to the MTR station (about 1 km away from hotel), from where u r already half way to the Luohu checkpoint. all in all, the hotel is not bad, but who, except tour-groups "bussed in" from mainland China (and I am very sure this is their main guest clientel), would want to stay so far out of town. not me. next time i will stay in Kowloon or HKG Island again, certainly not at the new territories. and I will make sure my itinerary will not collide with any major event that causes the room-rates to skyrocket. sorry, no pics from this one, left my cam on an Indonesian domestic flight few weeks later, as already mentioned in my other reviews..... sob sob sob :-(

Reviews.Title: “quiet and away from the busy city”
Reviews.Author: hothotelbunny
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for approximately 9 months from june 2008 to march 2009. pros: -great housekeeping staff. always helpful and very pleasant. -rooms are clean and quite spacious by hong kong hotel standards. -easily accessible. hotel has shuttle bus to kowloon and hk island, as well as the mtr stations. -malls available within 10 minutes walking distance. -convenient stores aplenty just outside the hotel. cons: -quite a distance from the city (kowloon/hk island) -rooms on lower level are a little tired, though there are newly built rooms now on higher floors. i would recommend this to any long stayer in hk who is looking for a quiet stay, away from the busy city. if you're in hk for less than 7 days, try looking for other hotels in the city..

Reviews.Title: “not again”
Reviews.Author: chansy
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel because of some positive reviews at this site and also because of its location. Very convenient to get to from the airport on the A41. Reception service was adequate and in general solicitous. We liked the size of our upgraded room and that is about all we liked unfortunately considering our reservation was upgraded to a deluxe room. On entering our room there was always a musty or unpleasant smell only somewhat mitigated by the air conditioning. We endured unchanged sheets for at least 3 nights out of the 4. Did not pay attention the 2nd night. In all fairness I believe we had fresh towels daily. There was a refrigerator and complimentary tea/coffee bar and facility for internet and wireless. Unfortunately, the prices for the internet were exorbitant. The furnishings were well worn and the mattress spongy. The carpet in the room had seen better days, not to mention the stains in the carpet in the hallway. The total ambience of this hotel left much to be desired. It had the quality of a grand central station quite unsettling to say the least. We did not bother to check out any of the other facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, comfortable stay- quiet location”
Reviews.Author: upg_uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in Jan10 for 4 nights and had a comfortable stay with no problems at all. This hotel is located 20mins by MTR from main HKG in ShaTin area which is very quiet and on the river. They have basic and club rooms to suit every budget. Our rooms were basic but clean, hygienic and had a river view that we loved to wake up to. It is very easy to move around from this hotel using train on octpopus card that is accepted by trains, buses, ferries and even cafes. There is a shopping mall close by and has a variety of restaurants and cafes inc Mcdonald and Pizzahut. The staff was polite but always in a hurry since they were always busy and the language can be a barrier sometime. After the hustle and bustle of main HKG it was nice to come back to this hotel for a bit of peace and quiet and loved to walk by the river, This place is very safe day or night and would recommend to anyone. Its good value to money.

Reviews.Title: “Why choose this !?”
Reviews.Author: Englandtravelgal
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutly terrible, it smelled really bad we only booked rooms, no food, We went around the hotel and there was really cheap resteraunts around that we ate from. you could buy breakfast from a convenience store which was much cheaper then the hotel.The swimming pool is absolutly filthy, in our room we looked down at it and there was a brown swirly thing in it , we didn't even go down to the pool. We stayed out of the hotel as much as we can, the extra bed made my brother sick and he cried all night. It is very polluted here, humid hot and sweaty. The shopping is alright Nathen road is where we always went and somtimes went away from there. The hotel is very far from the shops, and the octopus passes are expensive because it cost so much to get away from the Hotel. Waiting at the bus stop was aghony, it smelled liked sweat and more worse SEWAGE absolutly terrible never want to go back !

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but far away...”
Reviews.Author: Mmonkie
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Regal Riverside in Sha Tin, Kowloon, HK. twice in as many months. I have had the opportunity t stay at both the iClub rooms and the regular rooms. Personally I prefer the normal rooms. The new rooms are nice but have a love hoel feel with mirrors on the walls and even on the ceiling. That was ok but everything else was white, it gave the room a, IMO, a cold sterile uncomfortable feel. The normal rooms are massive, enough space for 2 beds and still space for a couch, coffee table and a chair. In terms of comfort, maybe 'cos its still new, the bed, pillows and comforter in the iCLUB rooms are great, very very comfy nights sleep. The downside. It is in Sha Tin which is in the middle of nowhere. Its HKD100 to get to Tsim Sha Tsui. The last hotel shuttle to the hotel leaves the city at 10;15pm. So you ahve to plan everything to fit the schedule. To tke the trains = 3 trains and a taxi ride from the city. Another downside is that the hotel caters to mainland chinese groups, unfortunately this makes the hotel very noisy. My pet peeve was the constant shouting in the hallways and the constant knocking on my door, they seem to always find the wrong rooms. If you dont mind the travel and its isolated location, the Regal Riverside is actually a nice comfy hotel. But if I was on a short trip where every minute s precious wuld choose a location closer to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Startingpoint For our Hong Kong Holiday”
Reviews.Author: GrAv3n
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the Regal for 5 Days. The Reseption were always great, They all spoke English well and was always availble to help and give direction. The rooms were of a good size and very clean, a bit old but still fine. The hotel is within walking distance of the New Town Plaza and Shatin MTR and Bus terminus. The busses and Taxi's Stopped infront of the Hotel and there is a shuttle service available. The Hotel is great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nacnud88
Reviews.Content: This HK hotel warrants a 4 star rating for service, facilities and a nice large well furnished room. Paid $600HK for room including Internet and return airport transfer. The MRT is about 15 minutes walk and breakfast is readily available nearby. Not as convenient as downtown Kowloon but the value and comfort of the hotel is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Newly design room”
Reviews.Author: FAJAHK
Reviews.Content: Good location, easy to access different transportation e.g. A41 airport bus, free shuttle bus service from hotel to Shatin Railway Station. 10 minutes walk to Sun Tin Wai Railway station. Surrounded by plenty local chinese food shop. Cyber feel newly design room with plenty mirrors and semi-see through glass enclosed toilet inside. Romantic for couple but inconvenience for visitor or tourmate

Reviews.Title: “nice but not first-rate”
Reviews.Author: DrGoldin
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly acceptable hotel but not by any means one of the most comfortable in Hong Kong. Also, it's pretty far away from the main tourist areas, so unless you have reason to be in Shatin, this isn't the best location for you. The rooms are spacious and have everything you need (including a wired and wireless internet connection, available for HK$150 or 180 per night, respectively). Also a minibar with a small assortment of overpriced beers and soft drinks that's more or less replenished every day. The bed is new and quite comfortable (for those who like solid back support), but the furnishings are starting to age. The plumbing looks at least a decade old. Breakfast consists of a buffet that doesn't change from day to day and isn't really a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Awful smell and awful customer service”
Reviews.Author: travelchick000
